165001.name: Tenocha: Heroic Adventures
165001.description:
From publisher blurb:

TENOCHA IS a slowly collapsing accord of city-states, occupying a jungle-covered continent that is populated primarily by humans and mostly-humans.

IT IS A PLACE WHERE some things are very different. Most significant property is owned by clans rather than individuals. There are people with elemental powers, and people with scales, living on every street – and their powers are directly incorporated into industry and life. And Tenochans, while having the same degree of physical sexual diversity as real people, often marry in groups, and sort themselves into three base genders, rather than two (man, woman, arha).

IT IS A PLACE WITH PROBLEMS. Just off the eastern coast of Tenocha lies the reach, an island chain ruled by dragons and with whom Tenocha is perpetually at war. It has enemies inside; cults operate in secret across Tenocha, calling up diabolical entities to bind or worship. It is built on an unstable base; the magical industries of the region are powered by decaying artifacts, which cannot be repaired or replaced easily. And it is stratified - Status is based on age, class, race, and gender, in a system vastly different from our own, but still one that is deeply imperfect and unequal.

Note: THIS IS A LIVING DOCUMENT. It might be updated every week for a month at some point; it might sit dormant for a few years.

165002.name: Iron Bay Virginia (M&M 3)
165002.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greetings from AHC; the wait is finally over and the total overhaul has begun. Starting back from the beginning - Iron bay Megatropolis.

Here at AHC, it’s about you; “The Players and Gamers”.

This pdf has it all - action, suspense, violence, and a staring cast of characters, that you’ll never forget. This PDF gives you a new location to add to your campaign, along with specific locations and history. It’s perfectly designed to drop into any city like campaign with a special bonus - GM’s storyline central and also table top scenes maps (so you can print them out and drop them on top of your table and this will help out our beloved GM so that he or she will not will not have to describe set scene for the setup, just drop the scene on the table and grab you dice and “Game On”) also an example of a storyline broken down as an example module to get you started and ready to go, so let’s take care of our GM’s and they will take care of us.

165003.name: Recruiters
165003.description:
In Recruiters, two players compete to recruit the best group of candidates for the armed forces of their nation Uber Superb. Players need to spend their recruiting power wisely, balancing their efforts for each of the four service branches: Army, Navy, Marines and Air Force. It’s an advantage to recruit the most people, and it’s an advantage to recruit the best people. But that’s just the beginning, since allocating your recruits to hotspots around the globe is even more important, and... there are two ways to play!

In the standard game, there are two decks: one with all the Recruiting Power cards plus two Special cards, and the other with all the Recruit cards. Each player gets a hand of Recruiting Power cards, which are used to sway (i.e., buy) recruits which are constantly coming and going throughout the peak recruiting season. After this first part of the game, 2 VPs are awarded to the player with the most recruits. Then, four further and crucial competitions between the players will take place, and the player who best allocates his/her recruits to the aforementioned hotspots will earn the most VPs and win the game.

The "friendly" version of the game is a lighter, press your luck design, with unfortunate results for a too-greedy player.

165004.description:
Have you ever dreamed of commanding a powerful army? Have you ever imagined leading troops, which included elephants over the Pyrenees and the Alps to try to conquer Rome? Have you enjoyed a good historical novel dated on the old Republic of Rome, and you would like to travel to that time?

ONUS! Rome Vs Carthage is a war game similar to miniatures games in which both sides fight an ancient battle. The game is mainly based on the II Punic war, although battles from III to I B.C centuries can be also simulated. The game concept combines both, orders and events cards, that makes each game different and each combat becomes unpredictable and thrilling.

ONUS! can be played anywhere but to get the best gaming experience we do recommend a game area as large as possible, i.e. 3.2 x 2.9 feet (100 x 90 cm)

Units are represented by cards which have been scaled around a Centuria (also known as Century) or to a Maniple (also known as Manipulus), representing formations from 80 to 100 men for Infantry units, 20 cavalrymen for Cavalry units or 6 Elephants.

Units have their own set of traits to represent permanent attributes of the unit, like Melee Combat, Range Attack, Defensive capacity, Morale and Life, and Movement capacity. This set of traits gets bonuses and penalties depending on the ongoing situation and combat engagements.

Units also have their unique set of skills to represent specific abilities they can perform: from defensive formations to extremely effective techniques to attack enemies. Some of these skills need to be activated, meaning only one of them can be used in an engagement, while others are inherent to the units.

Leadership is represented in the game by the figure of the General. A General’s token represent his HQ and its own escort. In addition to the leadership benefit, a General grants bonuses to nearby units, boosting the morale of the troops and providing additional benefits when they are engaged with the enemy in those bloody encounters. Both, Hannibal and Scipio, two well-known Generals are included in the game with their unique set of bonuses! Also, Heroes, Veterans and Elite units take part in Onus!

In more detail, ONUS! Rome Vs Carthage is played in turns, composed by six different phases each:

1. Activation of Units: in this phase, the active player can play any number of Order cards from his hand, stating what units are going to be used during the turn.
2. Movement and Charges: in this phase, the active player may move all those units activated in the previous phase. Those units finishing their movement in contact with enemy units, may Charge against them.
3. Range Attack: those active units able to carry out Ranged Attacks and which haven’t moved or executed a Reduced Movement may shoot enemies within its maximum range. Also, special units like Skirmirsher have this skill, thus they may want to use this ability.
4. Skirmishers: units having these specific skill can harass enemy units, provided they haven't spent all their movement points.
5. Combat: All engagements are resolved in this phase, being the active player the one choosing the order of combats.
6. Flee Movement: units fleeing continue their movement if Morale checks fail.
165004.name: ONUS! Rome Vs Carthage
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 089 - Sylvion

165005.name: Table Scraps Issue 1
165005.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Table Scraps, a new series of supplements for the Mutant Future role-playing game by Goblinoid Games.

Table Scraps is a two page supplement that will include various items for use in the Mutant Future game. This issue introduces the Radioactive Skeleton, the Rad Suit, the delicious and dangerous Fuzzwhat cactus, and a couple new weapons to boot.

The PDF is book-marked and includes layers so that the backgrounds can be turned off for ease of printing.

165006.description:
Set of three promo cards to add to the base game.
Includes Murder Board Discussion, Murder Board Evaluation, and Murder Board Review.
165006.name: Castle: The Detective Card Game – Murder Board Promo

165007.name: Nutriventures: The Boardgame
165007.description:
The game provides a unique experience for families. The challenge is adaptable to the players desire and can be played in Single or Cooperative mode.

THE OBJECTIVE
In the begining of the game, players receive 4 objective cards of different type that indicate witch tokens they have to find (the tokens in the game setup are placed face down in random order) in the different game-boards. The 4 tokens must be found and placed on each player character sheet in order to a player (or players in coop mode) be able to chalenge the vilain in the end phase of the game.

HOW TO PLAY
To move around, in the begining of the turn, a player must take a random encounter card that tells wich character (good or bad) he encounters in his voyage. These cards must be resolved first according to the symbols printed on them. After this, each player moves its marker the number of spaces indicated on that same card.

Players then explore the boards turning the tokens around and seeing what lies beneath, looking for their 4 objectives.

Hidden beneath the tokens may be be good things, objects or enemys. Players use the power of food and good nutrition to overcome obstacles trought matching food cards color sequences.

MEANWHILE
At the same time that players ares trying to find their objectives, the clock is ticking and they have only 10 rounds to prepare for the final battle against the bad guy....he has is hown character sheet that plays automatically against the players.

Players must find their objectives and at the same time try to find out the villains hidden location in the factory for the final battle, if they fail to do this, even if the their objectives are met, the bad guy wins the game.

THE STORY
Our story takes place in a land called NUTRILAND, where food had enormous powers, called NUTRI-POWERS. People lived happily and had a healthy and balanced life. The big NUTRILAND FACTORY, managed by MURDOCH and a team of good nutritionists, led by NEUS, made ​​the processing and distribution of food to the entire population.
ALEX GRAND, the terrible villain, seized control of his father’s factory with the help of NOSE, a despicable bootlicker and his right arm, and subverted MURDOCH’s dream using the Factory to produce and distribute GENEX-100, a caloric compound of his making.

Before ALEX destroyed everything, NEUS instructed its seven most experienced nutritionists to flee, so that each one would preserve a food group. Thus they became Nutri-Masters and created the seven kingdoms of nutrition where even today they retain the foods that were entrusted to them and the secrets of their incredible NUTRI-POWERS.

30 years later NUTRILAND became gray and entirely dominated by ALEX GRAND, which gave it a new name - GRANDLAND. The population forgot food over time and ALEX became an businessman adored by all and the GENEX-100 the only food available.

Having realized ALEX’s scheme, and having discovered the existence of food, TEO, LENA, BEN and NINA take on the exciting mission to discover the seven kingdoms of nutrition and restore food diversity to GRANDLAND.

rpg: P.E.R.K.: The Pretty Easy Roleplaying Kit
165009.name: P.E.R.K. Core Rulebook
165009.description:
From product website:

The basic rules of the game including dice systems, character creation as well as basic Perks, skills and Special Abilities. This is required for play but can be supplemented with one or more Setting Rulebooks.

165010.name: The False Prophet
165010.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure was designed to drive your players crazy! A magical maze with teleporting doors and moving blocks...rooms filled with deadly undead and constructs...a puzzle room with multiple traps and hazards...and all while being hunted by an Obsidian Minotaur!

3.5 Compatible Adventure for 4 PCs of levels 8-10

After a near death encounter with a Behir, the Adventuring Party will accompany a nomadic tribe to the Village of Etzal. There they will witness a bizarre religious ceremony in which one of teh tribesmen is sacrificed to the deity Atesh. After some investigation, the PCs will have reason to doubt the sincerity of the village's new religious leader and this ritual he has recently initiated. What they don't know is that his tower is a magical maze where they will be hunted by a variety of creatures and exposed to a puzzle room where they will need to rely on their wits to avoid certain death.

With this Purchase you get:

An Adventure book (25 pages) that includes:
Complete Stat Blocks for all creatures and GM Reference Maps as close to the description of the encounter as possible.
Fully developed religious mountain village (Etzal) that includes a map and descriptions of notable places and NPCs that can be used for future adventures.
Fully developed new Religion (Order of Atesh) practiced by nomadic tribes or other desert dwellers.

A Map Book (27 pages) that includes:
Ready to Print, scaled (5' = 1") letter sized, multiple page PDFs in color for all combat encounters. No need to mess with printer settings - just print, cut the white margins, and glue/tape together so that the overlapping parts match for a seamless map.

165011.name: Härjapõlvlaste Riid
165011.description:
Härjapõlvlaste Riid (Quarrel of the Leprechauns) is based on an Estonian fairytale.

There are berry-cards with values 1-10, the Leprechauns with values 1-10 and some special cards in this game.
Also a die that shows how many cards player must draw before the round.

In her turn player plays a card on the table. The next player must play card with higher value on that card.
If a stronger leprechaun was played on the berry, he eats it and both cards are discarded. Then a new round starts.
If a player can´t play a suitable card he must pick up all cards from the table and a new round starts.

The objective is to get rid of all cards first.

165014.name: Myth: 'Who Brought Jokerman?' Promo
165014.description:
A Myth promo card released at Gencon 2014.

"Play this card immediately after another hero fails to hit with an Attack Action with an AP cost of 2. That hero may reroll his dice pool. If he fails to hit again, a Darkness Cycle activates immediately."

This card may be played as a reaction, adds 1 AP and can be used no matter what your movement has been.

165015.name: Myth: Gotta Get Those Ducats Promo
165015.description:
This is a promo card for Myth, given out at Gencon 2014

"Each time a Hero picks up treasure, he may do so without spending a movement point. In addition, the heroes gain 1 gold in addition to the treasure draw."

This card may be played as a reaction, adds 0 AP and can only be used if you have moved more than your maximum.

165016.name: Arkel: De Ontdekkingsreis Sinds 1442
165016.description:
A game jointly released by Identity Games and the Reinier van Arkel Group (the oldest psychiatric hospital in the Netherlands) in honor of the van Arkel Group's 565th anniversary. Players bid for control of one of six different ships on the board using a hidden bidding system that simultaneously determines how far that boat may move on that turn. The object is to pick up 'patients' in specific cities and deliver them to your own designated areas - but you have to be careful what you choose to carry because you may not be able to retain control of that boat on the next turn. Safely delivered patients reward players with varying amounts of dubloons and the player with the most dubloons at the end of the game (after there are no patients left in need of transport) is the winner.

There is also a small deck of 'Arkel' cards which players can acquire during the game and use for different one-off effects such as movement bonuses or cash bonuses. The Arkel cards also include facts and anecdotes about the history of the Reinier van Arkel Group.

165017.name: Mokra 1st September 1939
165017.description:
On 1st September, 1939, armies of Third Reich had attacked Poland. During the very same day, a battle took place, the battle that after many years later became a symbol of clash of old cavalry formations with modern tank units. Poles from Wolynska Cavalry Brigade bravely resisted the German attack of 4th Panzer Division. Regardless of concentrated tank assaults supported with artillery and airstrikes, Germans hadn`t achieved their objectives. Defenders suffered heavy casualties but retained fighting capability and continued to fight in the days to come.

Mokra, 1st September 1939 allows not only to recreate those events but also to check different hypothetical scenarios. Players decide about their forces` movement and they organize attacks or defense. Both sides enjoy certain advantages. Germans have large number of motorized units and strong air force. Poles need to make use of wooded terrain and an element of surprise - as Germans haven`t expected to encounter a such large cavalry formation in their way.

Players use basic rules of "Great Battles of Small Units" system - the same one that was used in "Primosole Bridge: 14-17th July 1943". The same mechanic are employed to represent a different battle of World War II. Few special rules were added to represent specific elements of that battle, like for example - an armored train "Śmiały" or German motorized infantry.

165018.name: Dynasty Warriors: Gundam Reborn
165018.description:
User Summary

The fourth entry in the Dynasty Warriors: Gundam series continues the familiar style of gameplay, but expands upon the previous games, allowing the use of the giant Mobile Armor suits and including additional pilots and suits from the various Gundam series. It particularly expands the roster available from Gundam SEED and Gundam SEED Destiny.

165019.description:
ELEMANCERS is a 2 player strategy-based fantasy board game that puts you in the polar conflict between the Light and Dark Factions! Both factions believe in either the worship of Creation or Death, and you command a faction to secure your elemental dominance in the world. Using the powers of Creation (Celestial, Beast, Flame) or Death (Shadow, Necro, Ice) you summon and empower creatures ranging from spell casters, to deadly skeletons and werepanthers, to enormous chimeras and dragons. The Cosmos is created and shaped by Creation and Death.

Whats your Fate?

Game Mechanics

Unique and imaginative Creature Cards, which each having their own powers and elemental alignments.

Ability Cards including magic and weapons which can strengthen your forces using the primal elements of Creation or Death.

Morph Cards which allow the player to add or subtract elements from a creature to transform it into another.

Saga Cards which provide hidden objectives for uncovering Lore Cards, which provide insight into the game background story, as well as unlock super weapons including dragons and powerful artifacts.

‘Fate’ tokens which act as in-game currency and controls what actions players can take each turn.

Exploiting creature weaknesses, bolstering your strength with Ability cards, luck of Fate dice rolls, and combat bluffing all influence effectiveness in battle.

Hidden creature card movement on tile locations which provide “fog of war” on the battlefield.

Four ways to win the game: Kill all enemy Heroes, capture the enemy Citadel, bring your Artifact to the Temple of Fate, or occupy that location of the enemy's Artifact.
165019.name: ELEMANCERS

165020.name: Missing Link
165020.description:
Missing Link is a party game for 4 to 20 people that takes about half an hour to play. Each turn, one person gets two cards with objects on them, then reveals one and keeps the other one hidden. That person is trying to get everyone else to guess the hidden object. The trick is that they can say only what is true about both objects. They can give unlimited hints and the other players have unlimited guesses. When someone guesses the hidden object, the guesser and the hint giver both get a card and the next play proceeds clockwise. The first player to get five cards wins the game.

Let's say for example, that you drew an airplane and an apple. You could reveal the airplane and say both these objects are bigger than a strawberry, both these objects might be found in New York, both these could fall on scientists. Frame your hints to get your audience in the right mindset. This free-for-all mode of the game works best with 2 through 10 players.

165022.name: €uro Crisis
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 7 - Ding & Dent's Holiday Gift Guide!
Heavy Cardboard Episode 37 – All the games!
165022.description:
€uro Crisis is a tactical as well as a satirical game for 3-4 players about the financial crisis in Europe. The players take the roles of banks with the goal of enriching themselves at the expense of the struggling states.

One game lasts for three years, with each year divided into four quarters. In each quarter, all players choose their action simultaneously and resolve them in turn order. As an action you can borrow money from the European central bank just to lend it in another action to the struggling states. You'll get good interest rates, especially when the state is nearly broke! But always be aware of the possibility that a state might have to restructure its debts.

From your earnings, you can buy gold and weapons. Gold is used to bid on privatizations of state property, which is the one thing that will truly be worth something at the end of the game. Your weapons can be used to defend your privatizations from an angry mob — or you can give them to decent citizens, just to see how the new privatization of another bank becomes public again. Last but not least, you have to be a good lobbyist to gain exactly the government or the reforms you want.

In the end, the player with the most points wins. Beside the privatizations, mainly income, but also gold, weapons and money add a few points.

€uro Crisis is entertaining, with a lot of interaction and invites everyone to gamble with borrowed money — just like the euro crisis...

165023.description:
Concordia: Britannia / Germania features a double-sided map for Concordia.


The Britannia map offers tight play with only 23 cities in ten provinces. Players start in London and Boulogne, expanding Britannia from the south.



The Germania map features 30 cities in twelve provinces again. The additional castles, different starting positions, and sea colonists moving along rivers bring new options into play.
165023.name: Concordia: Britannia / Germania
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good, The Board and The Expanded: Ep 46 “Expansions”
The Good, The Board, and The Ugly Episode 4:  Most Overrated games (or Joe’s Most Overrated Games)

165024.description: A promo card for Typo 2D: a joker card that counts as any letter.
165024.name: Typo 2D: Joker

165025.name: Cathedr'l: Fantasy Role Playing Chess
165025.description:
Using the strategy associated with chess, and the complexity of an RPG, adventure through the world of Cathedr'l and conquer the realm of battle.

Both sides have equal forces. Though, the pieces and their abilities, in addition to 20-sided dice (called action dice, or AD) are what makes this game maintain its role-playing aspect. Each character has the following attributes:

Hitpoints: Ranging from 8 to 14. Based on the physical prowess of a character, the Hitpoints of the character can change. for example, the Sorcerer only has 8 hitpoints, while the Knight has 12 and the Warrior has 14.

Armor Points: Ranging from 1 to 4. The difference between armor and health being that you can roll a D20 to try and negate damage as damage will always go to armor first.

Accuracy: This is broken up into either melee, ranged, magic, or shield accuracy. You must roll equal to or higher than the indicated number. Rolling a 19 or 20 will cause a CRIT, usually causing double damage. When you have to hit your target you roll however many action dice your weapon allows. Refer to your accuracy, and if the dice you rolled are equal to or above your accuracy, you successfully hit.

Weapons: Each character has some form of a melee weapon. Most characters will be able to cause either 4 or 6 total damage with their weapon. Though the way it is caused is different for every character. The knight with a flail rolls 1 action dice causing 6 damage. While the Crusader with his longsword rolls 6 action dice each causing only 1damage. The Cleric with his hand mace causes 4damage with 1 action dice, while the Sorcerer and their casting staff rolls 2 action dice each causing 2 damage.

Movement: Movements between the characters vary based on their maneuverability and battlefield mobility. The ranger holds roots to the Bishop of Chess, allowing them to go as far as they want in a diagonal line. The knight is able to move in the classic 'L-move' associated with knights of Chess. Though when it comes to the Crusader (able to move up to 2 squares diagonally) or Assassin(able to move up to 2 squares in ANY direction) Cathedr'l takes on its own personality as characters must use their unique movement to navigate the battlefield.

Spells: The Sorcerer, Cleric, and Paladin, utilize magic to support themselves and their allies in combat with powerful abilities only used by the select few magic users of Cathedr'l.

Abilities: Abilities are what will allow certain characters their unique traits. The Warrior and his Charge ability allow him, like a pawn, to move up to 2 squares on his first movement. The Paladin with the ability of STED, has built extreme strength and endurance and has an extra Hitpoint that regenerates at the end of every turn, essentially ignoring 1 point of damage whenever he is hit.

Using a system that is as deep and complex, as a tried and true RPG, and the unique strategy offered by chess, both players will use strategy and the role-playing aspect of a 20-sided Action Dice in order to outsmart and gain better positioning against their opponents.

In order to beat the game, you must slay your opponents King AND Queen. After slaying either of the two 'royal' characters on your opponent's team, all of the their characters that started the game on their respective royal's side of the board, go into exile and are removed from play. This allows for another layer of strategy as slaying your opponents king or queen can leave your opponent at half strength and weak against your troops.

165026.name: Ray Tracers
165026.description:
Ray Tracers is an arcade-style auto racing and combat video game released by the Taito Corporation in 1997 for Sony's PlayStation game console.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ray Tracers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165027.description:
From the publisher:

Our group was not prepared for the horrors of the Stygian Depths, as we have named the accursed lands below. Naught else but the world of the damned did we find, with creatures that defied all laws of nature, adn where the very earth seemed to tear at our souls. THe catacombs penetrated deep below, twisting and turning until emerging into a nightmare city of demons, a place long forgotten by the civilizations of man an donly whispered of by decrepit sages searching through the crumbling ruins of the underlands. . .
Journal entry-Johan Kurtz, 1681

Expansion rules for the ShadowSea miniatures game allowing for dungeon crawls.
165027.name: ShadowSea:  The Stygian Depths

165028.name: Chase H.Q. 2
165028.description:
Chase H.Q. 2 is a Japan-exclusive racing game released by Taito Corporation. It is a numbered sequel to Chase H.Q. The game was announced in AOU2007 Expo.

The game follows the formula of the original, but features 3D graphics.

The player takes control of three main vehicles, a modern stock sports car, a patrol sports car and a striped muscle car. Each level consists of one simple goal of racing to the end with the intent of defeating the villain vehicle, which has to be damaged enough to be taken down and the criminals taken into custody. Some villains have tricky tactics that make gameplay more challenging. Gameplay is also based on a point system.

Unlike previous Chase H.Q. games (including Special Criminal Investigation and Super Chase: Criminal Termination), the game features fictional automobiles modeled after real life cars.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chase H.Q. 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165029.description:
From the Publisher:

The column of energy began twisting uncontrollably, taking on a much darker hue of green and orange, shooting bolts of lightning in all directions. It was then that the tonic must have affected my vision for I could see a tranformation of the fire column. It must have been the tonic, I keep telling myself now, but there was something erupting from the column, snaking around men and pulling them, screaming, into the flames. The thousands of mouths filled with teeth, surrounded by flailing tentacles. . . clouds of foul smoke in the air, choking and vile. . . no, it must have been a vision. . .

A skirmish campaign for the ShadowSea miniatures game.
165029.name: ShadowSea:  Campaign Chronicles

165030.name: Crazy Taxi: City Rush
165030.description:
Crazy Taxi: City Rush was announced by Sega in March 2014 as a free-to-play mobile title for iOS and Android systems. City Rush is an game similar in concept to Temple Run, where the player does not have direct control of the speed of the taxi but can use touch motions to swerve in traffic and make turns.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crazy Taxi (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165031.name: Skeleton Creek
165031.description:
This intensely fun and spooky card game is based off the hit series "Skeleton Creek" by Patrick Carman. Just like the books, you must gather your friends and hunt for the ghost of Old Joe Bush! Be cunning, be careful and explore the mystery of Skeleton Creek...

The game starts with 4 cards being dealt to each player face down...one of the cards (placed randomly) is the Old Joe Bush card! At the start of every turn a player draws a card, they may then choose to play a card, but at the end of each turn a player may only have 4 cards in their hand. Each player must also leave their cards face down until it their turn. The game ends when the last card from the draw pile is taken. From there, each player (including the one that drew the last card) takes their last turn. The object of the game is to end with Old Joe Bush in your hand!

Use Night Vision to peek at another player's hand. Use Ryan's Journal to take the top card off of a player's hand. There are countless possibilities and strategies to use to capture the Ghost of Old Joe Bush!!

165032.name: Modern Combat 5: Blackout
165032.description:
Modern Combat 5: Blackout is a 2014 first-person shooter developed by Gameloft Bucharest and published by Gameloft. It is the fifth installment of the Modern Combat series. It was released on July 24, 2014 for the iOS, Android, Windows Phone 8 and Windows 8.1.

New to Modern Combat 5 is the ability to pick a soldier class ranging from assault, heavy, sniper and recon. The game had graphical improvement over its predecessor. An internet connection is required to play the game. The campaign focuses on Phoenix( a minor character in modern combat 4 ) trying to hunt down Saunders. Each mission is about 5 minutes long, noticeably shorter than previous entries in the series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Modern Combat 5: Blackout", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165033.name: Modern Combat 4: Zero Hour
165033.description:
Modern Combat 4: Zero Hour is a 2012 first-person shooter developed and published by Gameloft Montreal for iOS, Android, Windows Phone 8, BlackBerry 10 and BlackBerry PlayBook. It is the fourth game in the Modern Combat series, and is a sequel to 2009's Modern Combat: Sandstorm, 2010's Modern Combat 2: Black Pegasus and 2011's Modern Combat 3: Fallen Nation. A sequel was released in 2014, Modern Combat 5: Blackout.

The iOS version of Zero Hour supports the iPhone 5. Gameloft released a gameplay teaser on September 25, 2012, along with a new Modern Combat website. The teaser trailer showed high definition graphics, but with some graphical improvements over its predecessors, such as real-time shadows. Other improvements include more "military support" options, more tactical gameplay and more advanced campaign programming.

Source: Wikipedia, "Modern Combat 4: Zero Hour", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165034.name: Modern Combat 3: Fallen Nation
165034.description:
Modern Combat 3: Fallen Nation is a 2011 first-person shooter developed and published by Gameloft Montreal for iOS, Android, Bada 2.0 and BlackBerry PlayBook devices. It is the third game in the Modern Combat series, and is a sequel to 2009's Modern Combat: Sandstorm and 2010's Modern Combat 2: Black Pegasus. The fourth part of the series, Modern Combat 4: Zero Hour, was released in 2012, and the fifth, Modern Combat 5: Blackout, in 2014.

The gameplay in Fallen Nation is similar to the previous Modern Combat games, and also similar to Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare and Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2. The game's single player mode takes place over thirteen levels, in locales such as Hollywood, Alaska, and the Middle East.

The game is controlled using virtual buttons on-screen; a virtual control stick on the left of the screen is used for movement, while aiming is achieved by swiping on the touchscreen. Gyroscopic controls are featured on the iPhone 4, fourth generation iPod Touch and certain Android devices. The player can also crouch, throw grenades, use their weapon's iron sights, reload, change weapon, pick up different weapons, knife enemies, mantle obstacles, and shoot using buttons and prompts on the touchscreen. All controls can be customized from the main menu. The single-player campaign also includes Quick time events.

Source: Wikipedia, "Modern Combat 3: Fallen Nation", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165035.name: Modern Combat: Domination
165035.description:
With Modern Combat: Domination, teamwork, skill and fun are back with frantic gameplay in a top-notch game for the PS3™ system. Square off in 16-player battles in 6 modes and complete your objectives to rule the leaderboards! Discover a gameplay featuring the PlayStation®Move motion controller for unprecedented immersion in combat. Enlist in this immediately fun, challenging & realistic modern-war FPS for an amazingly low price.

Source: The Developer Website.

165036.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 211 - 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Game Master's Workshop: Newspapers as Props in RPGs
A Gamer Will Always Find a Way
I Hear Ya Knockin' But Nobody's Home
Top Ten Game Changing Games in All of Geekdom

165037.name: Maxwell Manor
165037.description:
From the Box

Meet Professor Arabesque...He's you. That is, you control him; and on behalf of the Psychical Society, Your mission is simple: find the Skull of Doom that controls Maxwell Manor, and learn how to destroy it. The answers are somewhere in the house, and it'll take a fast man with a fast gun to find the answers. Of course, you and the professor will have some help. There are treasures to find, vases to give you bullets and lives, and some special objects like gold coins and crosses to pull you out of danger or send away the nasties. Of course, you have to find them first before the nasties find you, but isn't that what life is all about?

More than 50 screens plugged full of challenge, danger and mystery. Over 100 variations combined with 10 skill levels equaling 1000 different games.

165038.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 212 - 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Close Encounters of the Random Kind
Commotion on a Hot Tin Roof
Game Master's Workshop: Improv and Role-Playing
165038.description:
"Let's Get this Party Started"

Cover by the Fraim Brothers.

165039.name: Cards Against Humanity: PAX Prime 2014 Panel Pack
165039.description: Cards Against Humanity held a panel at PAX Prime 2014 where they took submissions from the audience and either wrote them down or mocked them. The 10 best ideas were submitted to a printer immediately, and all panel attendees could pick up this special set before the end of the convention. It includes 5 white cards and 5 black cards.

165040.name: Province
165040.description:
Publisher's Summary for VGG
Two families vie for power as you settle a new provincial town. Build camps and banks, smithies and harbors and control growth as your town develops!

Province is a two player game where you must strategically manage your resources and workers to build, complete goals, and score the most victory points to win! The game features a communal worker pool representing the available workers in your town. Players move their workers to generate resources (Labor and Coin) that are used to build the various Structures, which in turn effect resource generation. But your opponent can also move the workers leaving you without the resources you need!

165041.description:
CargoTrain is a fast-paced card game with a train theme. Deliver as much cargo to the factories as you can. Plan carefully. Invest wisely. Anticipate your opponents' moves, and deliver the most stock in the quickest way possible. And, what’s most important, fulfill trade contracts. Let your adversaries watch the sparks fly from under the wheels of your dashing train!

Every turn in this game is divided into two phases. First is the planning phase, in which players plan their moves by playing move cards. Next is the action phase; this is the heart of the game. Players reveal their move cards one by one and perform actions (load cargo, deliver cargo, upgrade train, switch cargo order on the stations, pick up a new contract). There are many possibilities; players must choose wisely and plan ahead their moves. The gameboard is made from cards and players change it during the game.
165041.name: Cargotrain
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 17 – ZhanGuo

165042.description: Rivet Wars: Spearhead takes the fight to a new level. Now players will be able to fight with fixed turrets, canine units, all new infantry types and heroes trained to defeat the enemies defenses. The Allies can now drill under the enemy lines with the help of Lt. Brasseldun while the Blight can now be lead by the powerful Baron Munchen. With all these new units your army will crush anything that gets in its way!
165042.name: Rivet Wars: Spearhead

165043.description:
Battle with some of the greatest and most infamous heroes of Rivet Wars.

Rivet Wars: War Room gives players access to some of the greatest and most infamous heroes of both the Allied and Blight forces. These larger than life characters will enhance your armies with new abilities as well as their own martial prowess. Whether it’s Dr. Vorne, Romler or Patston, Uncle Rivet or the Iron Chancellor, Cruel Minie or Terror Nova, you’ll know that you’re fielding some of the war’s most feared soldiers.
165043.name: Rivet Wars: War Room

165044.description:
Plan your battle. Marshal your armies. Eliminate the opponent.

EverZone is a strategic card game set in a distant future. Each player is in command of forces in order to defend his race and expand the control in the universe. Three races (Numan, Slurr and Uthron, most commonly distinguished between humans, aliens and robots) fight for the galaxy on different battlefields: uncharted lands, seas of planets and in the cold space.
The game's goal is destroying the opponent's "headquarters" by reducing to zero his command points (same as life points). To achieve this, players have 330 cards between units, supports and locations in order to build their own forces deck to use in battle against opponents, in the locations determined by each player. EverZone introduces a revolutionary game mechanism to minimize random elements, creating extremely tactical challenges.

EverZone ist ein strategisches Kartenspiel, das in einer fernen Zukunft spielt. Jeder Spieler kontrolliert Truppen, um seine Spezies zu verteidigen und seine Kontrolle im Universum auszuweiten. Drei Rassen (Numan, Slurr und Uthron, gemeinhin auch erkannt als Menschen, Aliens und Roboter) kämpfen auf unterschiedlichen Schlachtfeldern um die Galaxie: unbekannte Lande, Planetenmeere, eiskalter Raum.
Ziel des Spiels ist, das gegnerische Hauptquartier zu zerstören, indem dessen Kommandopunkte (analog zu Lebenspunkten) auf Null reduziert werden. Um das zu erreichen, baut jeder Spieler aus 330 Karten mit "Units", "Supports" und "Locations" sein eigenes Deck, das er dann im Kampf gegen seine Gegner an den Schauplätzen einsetzt, die von den Spielern bestimmt werden. Das Novum an EverZone sind Mechanismen, die die Spielstrategie auf höchste Level anheben und den Zufallsfaktor auf ein Minimum reduzieren.
165044.name: EverZone: Strategic Battles in the Universe
boardgamepodcastepisode: I postumi di Spiel 2016 – Il Dado Incantato #12

165045.name: Quiz H.Q.
165045.description:
User Summary

Quiz H.Q. is a trivia game spin-off from Chase H.Q.. One player (or two cooperatively) chooses the correct answer from four possible ones. Each correct answer gets your car closer to the criminal you are chasing.

165046.name: Slavika: Equinox
165046.description:
Slavika: Equinox is both a standalone game and an expansion to the game Slavika. Players lead powerful families of the fantastic world Slavika, or — if they want — the new faction: Christians.

Each player has a team of six heroes. During the game, the heroes travel to different regions, fight monsters, and gain treasures. The larger the contribution of player's heroes in defeating monsters, the more glory points for the player's family.

The Pomeranian Regions are ruled by the eternal cycle of light and darkness,day and night, summer and winter. As time passes, depending on the current phase of the cycle, monsters will be weaker or stronger. According to the will of the princess of Slavika, the player whose family has the most glory at the end of the game earns the right to govern the Pomeranian Regions!

Integrates with

Slavika

165047.description:
Increase the fighting power of your Rivet Wars Army.

Rivet Wars: Second Wave increases the fighting power of any Rivet Wars army. In this expansion both the blight and allies receive powerful armored combat suits, mechanized fighting vehicles, new infantry types as well as heroes. Catch the enemy off guard with these new units, new capabilities and new tactics for winning the war!
165047.name: Rivet Wars: Second Wave

165048.description:
Bring the battle to the skies!

Rivet Wars: Battle of Brighton takes the fight to the sky. With this expansion players can field fighters, bombers, anti-air tanks and more. Bomb an enemy strongpoint, strafe attacking infantry or use your anti-air unit to shoot non-friendlies out of the sky. Use these flying machines to seize the upper hand and win the day!
165048.name: Rivet Wars: Battle of Brighton

165049.description:
Roll out the heavy armor with the big guns.

Rivet Wars: Heavy Metal rolls out the heavy guns and armor. With this expansion, players can deploy two of the largest armored units the blight and allies have ever produced. Along with that come two hero plug units and two turret plug units that allow you to upgrade your fighting machines making them ever more lethal. Send the enemy forces running when you roll out one of these mechanized monsters of the battlefield!
165049.name: Rivet Wars: Heavy Metal

165050.description:
Take your battlefields to a new dimension

The Rivet Wars: Terrain Pack brings more realism to any Rivet Wars game board. Each piece of plastic terrain is skillfully modeled and detailed to create not only realistic looking battlefield elements but ones that will work with the miniatures and the scale of the game tiles. The Rivet Wars: Terrain Pack will make tank traps, mines and barb wire true obstacles of the battlefield while bunkers and objectives become structures the miniatures can occupy.

Contents:

6x Bunker
6x Strategic Objective
6x Minefield
6x Barbed Wire
6x Tank Trap
6x Allied Flag
6x Blight Flag
165050.name: Rivet Wars: Terrain Pack

165051.name: Doom Tomb Tactics
165051.description:
Journey treacherous tombs, vanquish vile creatures, defend your homeland from ancient evil. Oh, and don't forget to grab the loot!

Doom Tomb Tactics is a strategy-adventure game which pits one or two players against The Wretched, a dark and powerful force who has returned from the grave to strike fear into the hearts of the peaceful Onakwan people.

Each player assumes the role of one of four classic characters, each with their own unique skills and abilities. Heroes traverse four different Levels, infiltrating Tombs in an attempt to slay the abominations within, and if successful, claim defeated Wretchs' Loot, which can later be used to purchase Artifacts including weapons, armor, and spells. During exploration and combat, Heroes spend Power Tokens to activate and resolve Artifacts and Special Abilities, and can also seek out Treasure, including more Loot and Power Tokens, but beware. Sometimes it's a Trap!

Each level is constructed with four Maps. The first three of these maps are completely randomized, and contain various obstacles and enemies, while the last map contains the level's Tomb Boss. To accomplish their Quest, the Heroes of Onakwa must fight their way through these Forbidden Tombs and defeat all four Tomb Bosses, including the dreaded Zhakoros.

165053.name: Sega CD Backup RAM Cart
165053.description:
The Sega CD Backup RAM Cart is a utility that holds 16 times more game information memory than the internal RAM memory of the Sega CD (with its storage size being 1 Mbit total), which is useful for long-playing games and for not having to start over at the beginning every time the player(s) starts a game. It retailed for $60 U. S. upon initial release.

Source: Sega Wikia, "CD Backup RAM Cart ", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165054.name: Totally Spies!
165054.description:
From Wikipedia,

Totally Spies will allow you to play with the 3 typical Beverly Hills girls who secretly work for the WOOHP (World Organization Of Human Protection). Jerry will provide you some high-tech gadgets as the lipstick-microphone or the multi-function Charm Bracelet. Your mission is to prevent earth from a global crisis: infiltrating a chemical site, pursuing on a snow bike criminal, saving hostages, and protecting celebrities.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Totally_Spies!_(video_game)

165055.name: Totally Spies! 2: Undercover
165055.description:
From Wikipedia,

Totally Spies! 2: Undercover sees Clover, Alex and Sam, three stereotypical Beverly Hills girls, catapulted into the dangerous world of international espionage where only their wit, attitude and high-tech gadgets can help them save the world.

Totally Spies! 2: Undercover includes 25 levels of gameplay. It combines elements of platforming, racing, puzzling, shooting and fighting. It is a sequel to the original Totally Spies!, which has been released only for the Game Boy Advance.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Totally_Spies!_2:_Undercover

165056.name: Resistenza
165056.description:
In September of '43 Italy became the pivot around which revolved the fate of World War II. After the fall of Mussolini and the declaration of war to Germany, Italy overthrew the course of the war. Playing Resistance you can choose to control the partisans, aiming to spread over the country to get consensus and support. Or you can step into the role of the Axis, trying to stifle resistance or discredit it.

Resistance is a strategic light wargame with historical and political elements for 2 players, which assume the role of the forces of the Axis or the Partisans. The game map outlines the North of Italy, enclosed to the south by the Gothic Line.

When playing Resistance you should give up concepts such as the "front line" and "grouping military forces". On the opposite, Axis and partisan must aim to spread themselves all over the country: the Axis should try to surround and round up the enemies, while the partisan should try to exercise political control over the population.

The Axis player controls a number of variable military units (about 20): the exact number depends by the political situation. The partesan player controls from 1 to 50 partesan units: the exact number dependes by the consensus coming from civilian population. The partesan player goal is to control the territory, in order to recruit more people than those dying each turn (which is inevitable). On average the partesan player should be able to recruit about 30-40 units of partesan fighters during a play, and lose about 10-20. This implies that the partesan ends the game with about 20 units. Since the Axis players has about the same number of units, the player having the number supremacy at the end of the play wins the game.

Resistance is based on very light wargame concepts. The actual game engine is the struggle for getting control over territory and raising population support.

165057.name: Totally Spies! Totally Party
165057.description:
From Wikipedia,

Sam, Alex and Clover decide to room together in their "dream house." Life couldn't get cooler, until they've unwittingly made their home right above an Underground Secret Services Center. To prevent a catastrophic security leak, Jerry, the Center Chief has no choice but to take on them as special agents.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Totally_Spies!_Totally_Party

165058.name: Totally Spies! Swamp Monster Blues
165058.description:
Back of the Box,

Here's your chance to save the world -- in style! The coolest girls to ever use a gadget, Totally Spies, are on a mission and need your help to solve the mystery of the missing government courier. Travel deep into the dangerous Louisiana Bayou to save him from the Swamp Monster -- all while avoiding getting mud on your too cool outfits. With the Totally Spies Swamp Monster adventure, you'll have fun learning essential skills like problem-solving, planning and decision-making, trial and error, reading, math and so much more. Extend the adventure using the 32-page puzzle code book included.

165059.name: Totally Spies! Zombie Jamboree!
165059.description:
From back of box,

Your mission is to find the missing courier! When a cute government courier disappears deep in the Louisiana Bayou it's up to the Totally Spies to save the day. Sam Clover and Alex need your help! Only with your aid can the girls solve the mystery of the missing courier in Totally Spies Zombie Jamboree!

165060.name: Totally Spies! The Mobile Game
165060.description:
User summary:

Beverly Hills teenage superspies Sam, Clover, and Alex are whisked away from their classroom by their boss Joey, leader of the secret World Organization of Human Protection (WOOHP). The Scarab of Salitis has been stolen from an Egyptian pyramid and the girls have to retrieve it. That first mission will then take them to Himalayan Mountains and finally a space station - 8 levels in total.

165061.name: Castlevania: Order Of Shadow
165061.description:
From Wikipedia,

Order of Shadows features gameplay similar to that of Castlevania: Symphony of the Night and other games in the series: it's a platform game with RPG characteristics, like the HP, MP and experience points.

Desmond Belmont, the playable character, has also a lot of weapons to collect along the game, like axes, swords and hammers, besides his standard leather whip.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Castlevania:_Order_of_Shadows

165062.description:
Unheimliche Begegnung im Schwarzwald has two modes of play. In the first mode, players assume the roles of reporters who are trying to get an exclusive scoop of UFO sightings in the Black Forest, an area of Germany.

Each player is assigned a color and a transmission tower. Their goal is to transport photographs with a hot-air balloon at locations in the state to their towers (transmitting the scoop back to their news agencies). Each player starts with one photo card, and take turns to roll a die, moving their card by the die's result. They draw new photo cards on a "6". The reporters can deploy Stop Stones to stop other reporters from moving through. The first reporter to transmit back three photographs wins the game.

The second mode of the game is called Top Secret, which is played on the other side of the game board. The game takes place in the news agency and players are racing against time to dig out what the others know. Each player thinks up a secret word at the start. On their turn, they roll a die, move their marker by the result, and can ask another player for one letter of their word. Players get points for guessing another player's secret word. The game ends when one player's marker reaches the end point and the winner is the player who has the highest score.
165062.name: Unheimliche Begegnung im Schwarzwald

165063.name: Sega Vintage Collection: Alex Kid & Co.
165063.description:
User Summary

Sega Vintage Collection: Alex Kidd & Co. is a video game compilation that is Part of the Sega Vintage Collection series, the compilation includes Alex Kidd in Miracle World (for the Sega Master System), The Revenge of Shinobi (for the Sega Genesis), and Super Hang-On (for the arcades).

Each game includes various features, such as time trial modes (where players complete a certain task in a certain part of the game), save states, replays (that can be shared with other players), stereoscopic 3D (for Super Hang-On), and the ability to choose the original Japanese dialogue (in The Revenge of Shinobi).

165064.name: Sega Vintage Collection: Monster World
165064.description:
User summary

Sega Vintage Collection: Monster World is a video game compilation and part of the Sega Vintage Collection. The compilation includes three titles from the Wonder Boy spin-off Monster World series: Wonder Boy in Monster Land, Wonder Boy in Monster World, and a newly localized version of Monster World IV.

Each game includes various features, such as time trial modes, save states, and replays that can be shared with other players.

165065.name: Mythos Expeditions
165065.description:
From publisher's webiste:

Bon voyage! You are about to depart on ten journeys into the unknown, following the trail of Cthulhu to isolated Pacific islands, into the icy wastes of the Arctic, through jungles and war zones and even off the Earth itself. In the blank spaces of the map, dark deities flourish and evil festers… but the truth waits to be discovered, secret knowledge that man may not be meant to know but that Miskatonic University covets. Into that mystery your Investigators go, armed with gun and camera and notebook, risking their own survival to keep those blank spaces from swallowing up the world.

Hurry on board — the gangplank is going up!

The Mythos Expeditions are a collection of adventures for Trail of Cthulhu, designed to be run as a stand alone with new rules tailored for expeditions or as part of the Armitage Files campaign setting in the core rules. Take your Investigators on an expedition into the dense jungles of central Africa, trek through the arid wastes of the Gobi desert, and clamber through the lost cities of South America. Your travels will you take you through the skies and across the oceans, into the lava caves of New Zealand and the frozen peaks of Patagonia.

165066.name: Sega Vintage Collection: Streets Of Rage
165066.description:
User Summary:

Sega Vintage Collection: Streets of Rage is a video game compilation and part of the Sega Vintage Collection series, the compilation includes all three Sega Genesis games from the Streets of Rage franchise: Streets of Rage, Streets of Rage 2, and Streets of Rage 3.

Each game includes various features, such as time trial modes (where players complete a certain task in a certain part of the game), save states, replays (that can be shared with other players), the ability to choose between North American, European, and Japanese versions (including the first worldwide release of the uncensored version of Bare Knuckle 3), and two-player online multiplayer (both co-operative and competitive) via Xbox Live.

165067.name: Sega Vintage Collection: Golden Axe
165067.description:
User Input,

Sega Vintage Collection: Golden Axe is a video game compilation and is part of the Sega Vintage Collection series, the compilation includes three titles from the Golden Axe franchise: Golden Axe (for the arcades), Golden Axe II (for the Sega Genesis), and Golden Axe III (for the Sega Genesis).

Each game includes various features, such as time trial modes (where players complete a certain task in a certain part of the game), save states, replays (that can be shared with other players), and two-player online co-operative gameplay via Xbox Live.

165068.name: Sega Vintage Collection: ToeJam & Earl
videogamecompilation: ToeJam & Earl in Panic on Funkotron
165068.description:
User input,

Sega Vintage Collection: ToeJam & Earl is a video game compilation and part of the Sega Vintage Collection series, the compilation includes both Sega Genesis games from the ToeJam & Earl franchise: ToeJam & Earl and ToeJam & Earl: Panic on Funkotron.

Each game includes various features, such as time trial modes (where players complete a certain task in a certain part of the game), save states, and replays (that can be shared with other players).

165069.description:
A convention exclusive Hero B card, first seen at Gencon 2014 and available at the Action Phase Games booth.

After a hero deals 4+ DMG to a villain, they roll a 6-sided die which will activate an additional action based on the result.
165069.name: Heroes Wanted: Gamer Promo Card

165070.description:
You have become a master of the super speedway, having tamed Saint Adriana. You have traded paint at the Velodrome. Verghn’s Grove is old hat. It’s time to become a full-season driver and step up to new challenges, including the very narrow short track, the sweeping turns of the quad-oval, or the fast mile. More road courses are included as well to test your mettle in more directions than left.

Thunder Alley now has a track pack. Four new tracks all peppered with new challenges. Some provide tighter racing and others allow for more wide open affairs. It’s all different and it’s all new. With these four additional tracks players can recreate full seasons of racing for stock cars or open wheels.

All tracks are compatible with both Thunder Alley and Grand Prix.
165070.name: Thunder Alley: Expansion Tracks

165071.name: Kingdom of Orbaal
165071.description:
From publisher blurb:

Orbaal, a fractious kingdom in Hârn's wild north, is a land of mountains and fjords. A land where the rebellious Jarin, beaten but not broken, chafe under the rule of Ivinian viking conquerors. Around 8,000 Ivinian conquerors hold almost all of the kingdom’s fortresses and rule over 65,000 Jarin. A major rebellion erupted less than 20 years ago and considerable tension still smolders between the two cultures, encouraged by an active but disorganized Jarin resistance.

Orbaal is an exciting kingdom for your Hârn campaign. The unstable political and cultural environment provides a variety of adventure opportunities for your PCs.

The Kingdom of Orbaal module is the perfect companion to other Columbia Games publications, including keeps, castles, and adventure sites.

165072.name: Barghest
165072.description:
From publisher blurb:

An alternative way to enjoy The Lazy GM. Maybe you need a monster for a campaign but don't want to buy a large collection. The Lazy GM Single Shots take a single monster and give variant Hit Dice, templates, builds and class levels for both Pathfinder and traditional 3.5 OGL, for a bargain price.

Barghests brings you brand new material, for a creature never seen before in any Lazy GM product. Barghests for Pathfinder and OGL at all stages of feeding growth, plus class levels and templates including the deathleech barghest, barghest monk, witch/assassin and vampire wizard.

A fully clickable index cross-referenced by CR and templates, plus bookmarks, means you can easily find just what you need.

165073.name: Star Run Falls
rpgissuearticle: Star Run Falls At a Glance
Star Run Falls At a Glance
165073.description:
From publisher blurb:

The elven village of Star Run Falls basks under the spray of the mighty waterfall, the Star Run. Thousands of fireflies hover nightly along the plunging waterfall, their blinking lights appearing as a cascade of flowing stars. The elves of Star Run Falls welcome visitors from all over who come to marvel at the sight of the waterfall and the river brings merchants to trade with. However, the long lived elves are facing sudden and rapid changes to their idyllic lives. Recent goblin activity forced a contingent of human refugees to seek solace within the village. The fast paced human lifestyle often clashes with the timeless elves who struggle with accepting the humans in their midst. Worse yet, an evil rumour darkens the surrounding forest- the dreaded Crimson Shadow King, an evil creature said to appear in the predawn hours, arriving on a chorus of chirping crickets to steal away elven babes for his growing goblinoid army. Additionally, unbeknownst to the villagers, a princess, fleeing an arraigned marriage, hides in the village with her “grandfather”- a legendary creature that serves as her guardian.

165074.description:
A medusa-in-training, Elysia's powers are coming along nicely, but she hadn't quite earned her master's degree when the invasion banished everyone from Arcadia. She can stun with a look, but, alas, her career as a 'real-life" sculptor is on hold (Yes, 'real-life,' not 'still-life'). While some University students often wondered about the morality of her particular field of study, Professor Morgan assured everyone that she was one of his most promising students. This wasn't the ethical violation they were looking for. We can go about our business. Move along.

An exclusive figure available only through the Kickstarter campaign.
165074.name: Arcadia Quest: Elysia

165079.name: Exchange
165079.description:
Exchange is a quick and casual game for 2-4 players to enjoy.

Players must collect three-of-a-kind for each suit, and then empty their hand to win. Reversible effect cards allow players to choose not only which card to play, but also how that card will effect the game!

Exchange is light-hearted, with a low skill curve making it a great choice for players of all ages.

165081.name: Winds of the Ice Forest
165081.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dreaded Ice Forest! Once a safe passage to the north, now the forest's evil magic seeks to trap and confuse travelers with ever-shifting paths full of terrible dangers. New monsters, new magic items, new magics!

This adventure for character levels 1-3 was designed for Labyrinth Lord but can be used with any old school dungeon-crawling RPG. It is a drop-in locale that can be played through in a few hours or in a much longer session...per the needs of your gaming group.

165082.name: The Legend of the Melusine Wife
165082.description:
From publisher blurb:

LEGENDS OF BEAUTY AND TRAGEDY

Stories have always been told of beautiful wives of powerful lords, with secrets deep that must be kept at all costs. Lesser stories also tell of wandering drunks and wastrels that fell into rivers, off docks and bridges, to their barely-mourned deaths. The Legend of the Melusine Wife, a short 'n' sweet Purple Duck Storeroom publication
gives insight into both mysteries, with a full account of the intriguing race of melusines, both male and female, and the cycle of their twisted love. Included is breathtaking art from Kristen Collins, two monster entries, and an additional two magic items that are closely associated with these tragic figures.

165083.name: SexyTime Adventures: the RPG
rpghonor: 2014 Indie RPG Awards Best Support Runner-Up
165083.description:
From publisher blurb:

The land of Sexonia is a dangerous place, a land of fantasy and adventure beyond your wildest imaginings. Maybe you got into adventuring because your village was destroyed by orcs, or to prevent fire elementals from taking over your kingdom, or maybe just because it was better than staying at home and settling down with that nice boy that your parents wanted you to marry. Whatever the reason, you can’t go home now. The kingdom needs you. And more importantly, that chain mail makes you look totally hot. Are you seeing anyone right now? Could I maybe buy you an ale some time?

...I’m sorry, where was I?

Adventure! Danger! Sexy outfits! Come, fellow adventurers. It’s sexytime.

SexyTime Adventures: the RPG is a Dungeon World hack in which you play a party of fantasy adventurers having adventures and being sexy.

THIS GAME IS A WORK OF SATIRE.

165084.name: Ashweald Hold
165084.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: the layout of a small palisade fort in the forest, in both summer and winter versions. Sharpened wooden palisades surround a small courtyard containing a few wooden buildings, used a storerooms, barracks, mess halls and watch rooms. The palisade has wooden platforms, reached by steps.

Uses: an outpost in the woods, manned by a small group of soldiers; The defended camp of a band of mercenaries or bandits; The stronghold of a barbarian warlord, demanding a toll of those that travel the forest.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, with both gridded and gridless versions.

165085.name: The Complete Index
165085.description:
From publisher blurb:

The One Page series gives the GM instant access to random tables full of woodland landmarks, strange objects, minor treasures, clever traps, and more! Each One Page product contains twenty unique, system-neutral entries in ready-to-roll format. Each entry can be easily adapted to any fantasy role-playing game.

The One Page Index is, as the title says, an index to all available and planned One Page products. Check out this quick reference to find what you need quickly and easily.

165086.name: Teamwork Feats
165086.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each book in the Echelon Reference Series is written to be a complete reference for a single topic.

This book focuses on Teamwork feats, feats that allow creatures to work together better than usual. From the PRD:

Teamwork feats grant significant bonuses but only function under specific circumstances. In most cases, these feats require an ally with the same feat to have a specific position on the battlefield. Teamwork feats provide no bonus if the listed conditions are not met. Allies who are paralyzed, stunned, unconscious, or otherwise unable to act do not count for the purposes of these feats. Inquisitors and cavaliers have special class abilities that allow them to use teamwork feats even when their allies do not have the feats.

The 47 feats in this book are all Teamwork feats that can allow your characters and their allies to work together in combat -- and in other areas! -- when they have like abilities.

This book contains feats from the PRD and from third-party publishers.

165087.name: Dark Heresy Second Edition: Game Master's Kit
165087.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dark Heresy Second Edition Game Master’s Kit is a vital resource for Inquisitors and Acolytes in their defense of Mankind. Within, Game Masters gain useful guidance and advice in crafting powerful Nemeses to act as recurring antagonists in campaigns across the ancient Askellon Sector. The kit also includes a brand new adventure that continues the action from the Dark Heresy Second Edition rulebook, and a deluxe Game Master’s Screen that puts the most commonly-used rules close at hand for easy reference.

165088.name: Blast Class Torpedo Interceptor
165088.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The small craft introduced in this installment of the series is a light 30 dT interceptor armed with a single torpedo.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

165090.name: CLUE: Firefly Edition
165090.description:
From the manufacturer:
River has been betrayed and handed over to the Alliance! Now with CLUE: Firefly Edition, help the Serenity crew discover who is working with the Alliance, what they used to betray River, and where on Serenity the kidnapping took place. Was it Inara with the Med Kit in the Engine Room? Or Mal with the Leather Necklace in the passenger dorm? Solve the mystery and save River!

165091.name: Shanghai: Triple Threat
165091.description:
User Input,

The classic tile matching game SHANGHAI has come to the Saturn in SHANGHAI: Triple Threat. Try to remove all of the tiles by matching them in CLASSIC SHANGHAI. For something a little different, try one of the three new variations. Get rid of pairs of free tiles only to have gravity intervene and drop higher tiles into the free space in THE GREAT WALL. Move entire rows to match tiles in BEJING. Challenge a friend as both of you try unearth THE GOLDEN TILE. With three new tile sets and three new ways to play, SHANGHAI: Triple Threat plenty of action to keep SHANGHAI fans busy.

165092.name: Virtua Fighter Kids
165092.description:
From Wikipedia,

Virtua Fighter Kids is an installment in the Sega AM2 Virtua Fighter fighting game series. A super deformed version of Virtua Fighter 2, it was released in the arcade and on the Sega Saturn in 1996. Unlike Virtua Fighter 2, it was developed on the ST-V board.

All the characters all have big heads, and the music is a faster pace. The gameplay itself is slightly tweaked from Virtua Fighter 2. The Saturn version includes some new FMVs and programmable button sequences to allow players to test and use pre-made combos. Despite being children, some of the fighters retain adult characteristics, such as facial hair, muscles or
breasts.

One of the variations of the boss character, Dural, features her with a fishbowl for a head, complete with a fish swimming inside.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtua_Fighter_Kids

165094.name: Millionaire: The Stock Market Simulation
165094.description:
User Summary

You start the game with $10,000. You can buy and sell stocks from 15 different companies. You can also use other types of transactions such as put options, call options, buy on margin, borrow against your net worth and more. The value of the stocks change on a weekly basis, So keep up on the news and invest wisely. Can you become a Millionaire?

165095.description:
Sail the seas! Recruit the best crew! Crush your foes and steal their loot!

Can you plunder enough treasure to satisfy your scurvy crew before the other captains? In Pirate Loot, players take turns recruiting crew to join their ship, hoping to have the best possible crew when the ships finally set sail. Win the round to get your hands on the most valuable loot, but beware! Just because you claimed the loot does not mean you get to keep it!

Pirate Loot is a fast paced parlor game of treasure and treachery for 2 to 4 players, created by veteran game designer Jason Bulmahn with art by Scott Kurtz and Dylan Meconis and graphic design by Mari Kolkowsky.
165095.name: Pirate Loot: Base Set

165097.description:
Wooden development markers for Kickstarter backers that replace the cardboard ones included in the box.

Packaged in a separate zip bag outside of the game box.
165097.name: Greed: Wooden Development Markers

165098.name: Esel bringe mir Glück
165098.description: The players start at space 0 and have to travel around the donkey to the spaces 1 to 6. They use donkeytails for playing pieces. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to roll a 6 gets the gray donkeytail and starts the game. The other players get to chose another tail as soon as they roll a 6 too. All players try to get on the same space as the gray tail to excange the tail for their own. Only the player with the gray tail can win the game when he reaches space 6. On the spaces marked with "X" the donkey steps on the tail and the player may not move again, till the first player has reached or passed space 1.

165100.name: Motorway Rest Area
165100.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 214th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a rest area along a motorway.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4320x4032 pixels in size at 144dpi.

165101.name: Octagon Shrine
165101.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 209th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small shrine with a slight asian touch to it.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4320x4032 pixels in size at 144dpi.

165102.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – ISS Defiant Mirror Universe Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165102.description:
The ISS Defiant was a Terran Defiant-class warship that was in service to the Terran Resistance Forces in the latter half of the 24th century. The Defiant was constructed and launched in 2372 by the Rebellion at Terok Nor, in orbit of the planet Bajor. The Defiant's design was based on specifications "acquired" from Deep Space 9 in 2371.

This expansion includes one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The ISS Defiant is part of the Wave 9 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165103.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Chang's Bird of Prey Klingon Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165103.description:
Chang's Bird-of-Prey was a prototype Klingon Bird-of-Prey commanded by General Chang in his efforts to discourage the potential peace talks between the Federation and the Klingon Empire.

This expansion adds one new ship and a new set of cards to Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Chang's Bird of Prey Klingon Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 9 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165104.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Scimitar Romulan Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165104.description:
The Reman warbird Scimitar was a massive, heavily-armed warship. It was constructed under the command of Shinzon as part of a secret plot to overthrow the Romulan Senate, defeat the United Federation of Planets, and liberate the subjugated natives of Remus.

This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Scimitar Romulan Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 9 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165105.name: Splintered City: Seattle
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
165105.description:
From the back of the book:

Seattle is a fractured city, split between history and modernity. The Unchained can stumble through rifts in time and space and wind up decades in the past. Why? Some failed experiment of the God-Machine? A side effect of human ingenuity? Or are the splinter timelines in the City of Flowers a deliberate design, leading up to something greater still?

Splintered City: Seattle includes more detail on the alternate timelines described in Demon: the Descent, as well as a host of story hooks and characters for use in your chronicle. Also presented are brief suggestions on what Seattle might hold for the other denizens of the World of Darkness.

165106.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Fina Prime Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165106.description:
The Vidiian starship was a massive starship utilized by the Vidiians in 2371 and 2372. This class of vessel operated with a crew of well over three hundred, and was armed with hypothermic charges and grapplers, which was used to access captured ships.

This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Star Trek: Attack Wing – Fina Prime Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 10 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165107.description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Regent's Flagship Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 10 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
165107.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Regent's Flagship Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

165108.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – 1st Wave Attack Fighters Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165108.description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Star Trek: Attack Wing – 1st Wave Attack Fighters Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 10 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165109.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Prototype 01 Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165109.description:
The Romulan drone-ship was an advanced experimental attack starship described as a marauder and developed by the Romulans in the 2150s. At least two prototypes of the vessel were built. The starship itself was a modified Romulan Warbird, with its propulsion systems and command circuitry largely identical to the typical Romulan warship of that era.

This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Star Trek: Attack Wing – Prototype 01 Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 11 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165110.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Alpha Hunter Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165110.description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Star Trek: Attack Wing – Alpha Hunter Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 11 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165111.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Fighter Squadron 6 Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165111.description:
The Federation attack fighter was a type of starship, employed by Starfleet as an attack fighter during the Dominion War.

This expansion adds a new Fighter Fleet miniature and a new set of cards to Star Trek: Attack Wing

Star Trek: Attack Wing – Fighter Squadron 6 Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 11 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165112.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ogla-Razik Kazon Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165112.description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Ogla-Razik Kazon Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 12 expansion packs from WizKids Games.

165113.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tholia One Expansion Pack (Retail)
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
165113.description:
Tholian starships were small starships of characteristic shape, utilized by the Tholian Assembly during the 23rd century. These vessels were armed with plasma torpedo-like torpedo weaponry. But their most powerful weapon was the so-called "Tholian web". This web was "weaved" by two or more Tholian vessels around an enemy ship.
