165230.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 1.5 - Sep 2014)
rpgissuearticle: What's Going on With Misfit Studios
165230.description: The fifth issue of Misfit Studios' Newsletter.

165231.name: Zombie Elves
165231.description:
From the PDF introduction:

There are no news from the friendly elven tree­village in the forest after their big summer solstice celebration. Moreover, some concerned and brave human villagers who went to investigate, have never returned. Something mysterious is happening, as some claim that the village is engulfed in a thick layer of chilly fog and unnatural silence . . .

165232.name: The Vault of Illusion
165232.description:
From the PDF introduction:

Long ago, the illusionist Hilduin constructed an underground vault wherein he practiced and honed his magics. Later, he announced that he'd concealed a potent magical device in the vault — the “Cube of Power” — to be claimed by anyone clever enough to retrieve it. Many adventurers entered the vault, but none emerged with the Cube. Will you be the first to bypass the vault's traps and claim the Cube of Power?

165233.name: In The Dying Light
165233.description:
User Summary:

Explore the dungeon underneath the cellar of a ruined abbey at Forkwith.

165234.name: One Last Tribute
165234.description:
From the PDF introduction:

Many years ago two large armies fought over a long lost cause. A brave knight who fell in the combat was buried in a lavish tomb. Over the years, the nearby swamp spread over and conquered the tomb. The knight's spirit protects the area and the nearby village. His name was Darius but none remembers it, yet for years the villagers regularly brought a tribute of flowers to his grave, in his honor. As the years passed, this custom waned.

Last month, a tribe of goblins moved into the swamp. This infuriated the knight's spirit, which in turn cursed the villagers. The villagers turn to the PCs for help, asking them to venture into the tomb and place a flower bouquet over the knight's grave, deep inside his tomb. The tomb has half-sunken into the swamp floor, and its two side wings are mostly underground. The floor is dirty and there are several holes in the ceilings.

165235.name: Goblinville
165235.description:
From the PDF introduction:

Goblinville is a small goblin community located in the outskirts of a vast ruined city. The goblins scavenge from the ruins, ever vigilant against predatory orcs and opportunistic adventurers. Chief Foz has turned their tiny village into a vertible goblin fortress.

165238.name: 97 Cent Space Battle
165238.description:
ALERT ALERT ALERT ALERT ALERT ALERT

“Admiral, sensors have picked up three Nickel Class Cruisers dropping out of warp.”

“Scramble the Centurions. Have the Dimestroyers set up a defensive perimeter around our HeadQuarter. If it’s a fight our enemies want, we’ll pay them back in kind.”

Welcome to 97 Cent Space Battle, where starships look suspiciously like coins and space combat is fought in two dimensions (unless the ships fall off the table).

In this game you’ll flip, flick, and spin your ships in an all-out assault on your opponent’s HeadQuarter.

The game itself is a free rules download. You'll need some table space and 97 cents for each player (1 quarter, 3 dimes, 6 nickels, and 12 pennies).

97 Cent Space Battle is played in two phases. During the deploy phase, the fleets warp to the combat area. Players flip their coins onto the table. The outcome of each toss (heads or tails) determines whether the ship made a perfect warp and can activate immediately. Just flick your ship at an enemy to blow it up.

During the assault phase, players take turns activating their surviving ships, until a player loses his Headquarter or his fleet is destroyed.

165239.name: The Dutch Oven
165239.description:
User summary:

Explore a forge that allows you to create magic weapons and maybe you'll find a powerful sword in the process.

165242.name: The Hidden Shrine
165242.description:
From the PDF introduction:

An old dungeon built under an fort, now abandoned and in ruins, that was later connected to natural caverns. Later occupants built a secret shrine upon an island of bones in the river. Now a Necromancer has found the place and kidnapped a family of nobles to sacrifice them to his blood god.

165243.name: Hermit Alchemist Tower
165243.description:
User summary:

You have been handed a map to an old alchemist's tower with a secret cave. Intrigued you decide to explore it, only to find an ongoing battle between Kobalts and ghouls when you arrive.

165244.name: The Ovens of Ar-Gar
165244.description:
From the PDF introduction:

After a perilous adventure involving an orc and his jealously-guarded pie, the still-hungry adventurers have searched the realms for the source of similar choice pastries. At last they approach a cave, drawn by the bakery-fresh odors emanating from its forbidding, black mouth. No orcs are visible, but surely where there is a pie, an orc cannot be far away.

165245.name: Water Genie vs. Undead Mermaid Gladiator
165245.description:
From the PDF introduction:

After a mysterious shipwreck in the open sea, the party sees a light far below. They investigate the lit-up palace. This adventure takes place 1,000 ft. underwater with all the deadliness that implies.

165246.name: Temple of the Dead God
165246.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you’re not an adventurer, don’t even try this. But, yes, this is the entrance, this is the door. Take the rope at the top of the canyon – it’ll drop you straight down to the temple of the dead god – some say a god outside of time. No matter. The temple’s outside time too, but trust the rope. It’ll make the trip. Once you get to the temple you’ll see some toys pieces you’ve met before slotting into place. The Old Fool and the Elf King are here, and some cloistered undead too, all watched over by Velistina, a friend of Edward Fulton, the captain of the Astral Star. She’s watching for shenanigans the Godslayer might pull trying to escape from Pirate Island. Don’t be fooled. He’ll use this door if he can. And if he can slay a god, what might he do to flesh like you?

165247.name: The Water Gate
165247.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ashiba, Master Druid, throws off his body when it gets old and takes a new one. It’s always worked for him and he’s brandished his power at the Gate for centuries. But now the other nature spirits have had enough of him. Sure, they’ve always known he’s an imposter, but he’s supposed to be doing it for them and not get co-opted by the very creatures he’s pretending to be. Just take it as a clue. Nothing is what it seems. That glorious Gate, so shiny, so white, so sparkling? The elephants? The little girls tripping up and down the steps? It makes a great display. But the Oglish-ka have their own cycles and seasons and they’re geared up to make some interference. Can you stop them? Will you help them? Play it anyway you like. But be warned. Watch out.

165248.name: The Sky Mines of Lowmoon
165248.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you find moontears in those brave new floating mines, just act natural. Don’t let on, don’t tell anyone. Just harvest them. Moontears are worth more to you-yourself-alone, than being the good guy and sharing the wealth. Just keep it secret. Use them yourself if there’s danger ahead, or send them home to sell and make yourself rich. Risking your life on those cloud runners, you deserve a bit more than the measly wages the company pays. And moontears can slow your fall, you know. You could spread a little on, sneak away. Drop down, drop out. Jenny Bluesky might help you. She doesn’t have a lily-white past herself, you know. But that guy in the shop? Phineas what’s-his-name at Shopland? Don’t expect any help from him. He’s all crisped up from an early life of hard knocks, and he’s just a “yes man” now. But take my word for it. You find some moontears? Check out your options. You’ll have some.

165249.name: The Woodsman's Cabin
165249.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wow! You might not have heard of such a thing, but now there’s a map of the future. It’s right here, issue #63, at the Woodsman’s Inn. Maps of the past - histories - they’re all very well, but now prescient, unaligned folks are tracing the history of the future. It makes sense. Stuff happens one place and astral reverberations shake up everything happening next and ongoing, ad infinitum. If the Godslayer got born here, you think you can even spend one night and not get shook up? Pick up the dice. They’ll be heavy. It’ll take courage, maybe even a rabbit warrior to mend this world where cause and effect don’t even work anymore. Leave if you like. But do you dare?

165250.name: Lowmoon Valley
165250.description:
From publisher blurb:

So Beautiful! You could live here forever. That’s what Ansel Mardain thought when the Elf King sent him to explore the Lowmoon Valley. Here, where the Moonshield River widens and slows, large expansive fields of grass grow tall as two dwarves and stretch from one steep canyon wall to the other. And the mushrooms! Buttery, rich - mushrooms everywhere. Enough to keep you alive forever. !Not! These are puppet-making, Broshly Mushrooms, intent, cunning, conniving. They will trap you. They will sift their tiny mycelium spores down upon your cheeks and into your knuckle bones and you too will become a glorious hill of magnificent mushrooms, buttery and rich. It’s the dark tide that corrupted these mushrooms. If you play it right, you might survive. But, stay together, and - don’t trust the natives.

There are also 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them. Added to that there is usually a table or two filled with rumors and encounters.

165251.name: The Medusa Sanctuary
165251.description:
From publisher blurb:

The locals called it the Medusa Sanctuary, but that was always sort of a colloquialism. If you capture medusas and dissect them and lock them up, is that sanctuary? Well, maybe not. If you bundle them all up and send them off to their own homeland, is that freeing them? That’s an improvement Aaron Alfast thinks and says a resounding “yes” to giving them their own flag. But the real decider is going to be Amoriliath, the Medusa Queen. She may have to square off against a mage controlled double, but put your faith in her. She wants to be free and she wants her daughters to be free. She’s powerful and the do-gooders are on her side. But what about you? Can sentient beings be monsters? Pick a side. Just mind your eyes. Bring a mirror. Maybe a back-up.

165252.name: The Narrows
165252.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a defiled shrine at the Moonshield Narrows there’s a plot brewing. If it succeeds, demonic hordes will be home free, free to stream in and rule the world. The party is doing maximum counterplotting, but they need help. Screw up your courage in #66 and pit yourself against alchemist Amish and his dangerous concoctions. He’s a charlatan and only in it for the excitement, but don’t be fooled. He’s dangerous. And beware Mogtail and Bestrian, dangerous women in love with dark powers. Maybe worst of all? You’ll face spider goblins. Opposable thumbs give you an edge, you say? Try facing goblins with six of them! You might be thinking the world you live in is dark, but now get acquainted with dark. #66 is dark- the Moonshield Narrows seeded and warded with Merosakkan Stones. Nothing pretty here. This is about slamming the gates of hell.

There are also 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them. Added to that there is usually a table or two filled with rumors and encounters.

165253.name: Gremlin's Watch
165253.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you can afford it, Gremlin’s Watch is a good place to keep your enemies. For a fee they’ll lock up anyone there and Severen took advantage. Blond and gorgeous and rich, he got co-opted by the lycanthrope king and needed a safe place to build his base. So he paid the fee and got locked up. Protection is protection, he said, even when it’s called incarceration. Problem is, Severen’s made a deal that will force human evolution down the lycanthrope path, and, you’ll know when you see him that, attractive as he is, just about everybody is going to accept his embrace. So, now, today, maybe more than ever, it’s up to you. Saving the world from tyrany was maybe necessary, but at Gremlin’s Watch we’re back another bunch of steps in the cycle. Join the party. Fight the weres. Keep the world safe for humanity.

There are also 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them. Added to that there is usually a table or two filled with rumors and encounters.

165254.name: The Ten Canyons
165254.description:
From publisher blurb:

Growing up in the canyons, Alphonse has seen many dark tides and seen the pillar of holy fire burn bright in the ruins of the city. He has seen strange creatures come out of The Narrows and stranger adventurers go in after them. But for the most part, Alphonse keeps these stories to himself. Not so Agline, a battered adventurer. Right now, stories she tells are fueling talk in the bars of the unaligned. Vanifric, knight of the Society of the Rose, he just watches. So does Privitine, the eye of the Great Worm. She watches Vanifric. He watches the prison of the Demon King. And, you? What role will you play? Whatever else - don’t be afraid. The demons feed on fear. So, pick, choose, decide. Try. Be a player. Save the canyon.

There are also 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them. Added to that there is usually a table or two filled with rumors and encounters.

165255.name: Statue Garden of Shiel
165255.description:
From publisher blurb:

Life extension? Keepsake Boxes? You figure it out. Bigger on the inside than the outside, keepsake boxes can hold lots and lots. Sort of like a human mind that holds so much inside a tiny space. Maybe use a keepsake box to preserve knowledge? Maybe to preserve life? Hmm… The civilization of Shiel, ancient now and gone - who wouldn’t want to unlock its secrets? If only the Library of Shiel could be found. If only, if only… Investigate the Statue Garden here in #69 for some clues to all that. Feel the power of Madrillian, angel entity and nemesis of evil. And take Helga with you. Yes, just a child, so hold her hand. She will open many doors for you. And remember - a six is a nine turned upside down, so it’s a puzzle. It’s a wonderment. It’s going to be fun.

165257.description:

Point Landfall marks the end of the mighty Moonshield. The saga goes that Mardain the explorer made landfall here. A monument to him stands as a tall reminder. But, that inscription? “In memory of the lies men tell to gain power?” What can it mean? Therein lies a tale of deception and fraud. It gets woven all together and !surprise! out comes a parasite that bestows good upon the human race and doles out punishment on evil. Did Mardain leave his mark on the world, or, did he just get used by the world to make itself a better place? Blasphemer’s Blood makes a difference, of course. But nature has its own devices. Was Mardain just a spore eating device of nature? Play #70 if you dare. But, please! Hold the mushrooms.

165258.description:

The Astral Star has been caught between planes of reality, muddling up cause and effect for years. Now it’s crashed in Water City, or at least parts of it have ended up in the river there and gotten turned into a Tavern in the Sky. Poor Emma. She was innocently getting a squeeze on with a local boy, but now she’s become a remote viewing device playing an ancient instrument that fell with the Star parts. Jurlamon’s on his way. He thinks the Astral Star is really his baby. Maybe. But it’s hard to pinpoint. Earths got the 24 hour thing going with a sun-moon-stars setup, so how can the Astral Star ever get stable enough to stay put? Lots of questions. Play it out. See if there’s an answer.

165259.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the home of House Mitrain. This is the home of the Stone Demon Pits that birthed the three hundred foot tall demons towering on the landscape. Some demons stand, some sit, some march. Heveric Hoblinhouse thinks she can control the demon called Des-mogoth with a Demon Rider’s Rod. Her qualifications? She discovered a famine-busting bread made of lichen and dandelion and ended up the last one standing. Heveric is just a fulcrum of history and will need a lot of help. Beware though. There are weird, little stone constructs from fairyland that like to steal children ducking in and out and around the pits, as well as mean, minor demons eager to create something nasty. You’ll find some Stone Armor here. Use it. The Moonshield was cozy compared to these Demon Pits.

165260.name: The Court of the Slave Lord
165260.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you know the way, never say so. If you’ve seen it with your own eyes, deny it. That’s the way the Slave Lord wants it. Don’t ever tell where the Court of the Slave Lord is. He might use his Will Taker on you and shove you through your paces anyway he wants forever. He’s a bad guy, but be warned, he’s got good magic. Take a look at those henchmen of his. He made the bird guy himself. That guy, for all his chirping good humor, is the spell brother to the chain golem on the Slave Lord’s other side. Hatchet men and counselors both. No milk of human kindness here. So, if fighting evil’s your gig - step right up. You found it. It’s here. Toys #73.

165261.name: The Well of Hours
165261.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hate to break it to you, folks. Maybe it’s not what you’d choose, but you’ve got a role in the great chess game of the future. First step? Go to the Well of Hours. You’ll find all of time there, past and future. Be sure you know which gate to take and if you decide to use the Ghost Wind? !!!Read Instructions First!!! You’d rather find a safe place? A good place to hide out? Then hide as someone doddering and incompetent like a House Delphine mage. They wrote the script on that ploy. But get going. The finger of history is pointing at you. Pull on your boots. Jump into the space where every possibility exists. Scared? Then go with Fredric. He’s a game guy. Knows how to have fun, too. Knows how to get a job done.

165262.name: Conjunction
165262.description:
The game is a mostly abstract strategy game with a space theme. The board represents the solar system.

Each player draws a hand composed of three different planets in the solar system. On their turn, each player then roll dice and move the planets around the sun in an attempt to get the planets into an alignment. Once an alignment has been achieved, the player scores a point, draws three new planets, and attempts to make a new alignment.

The first player to score three points wins.

165263.name: The Rusted Vale
165263.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outside the gates of the Elf King’s palace, Kryzcazzca still holds court from inside the Emperor’s preserved head. Filthy rain and soot fall constantly and drizzle down to the valley below. The soil is red with rust. This erstwhile green and bustling valley is now The Rusted Vale. Soul locusts live here, burrow wights, too. And scavengers, but barely, living hand to mouth. Abbot Eister knows it’s time to evict Kryzcazzca and he needs adventurers to help. !Please help! But keep safe and watch out for distractions. There are lots of leftovers of death hanging on around here. Don’t get drawn in when spectral soldiers fight on moonless nights. Avoid the territorial, aggressive piles of scrap that actually are soul locusts intent to destroy you. And, one last caution? Watch out for the Junk Man. He wants firsties on everything. He hopes you die.

165264.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mages of House Vour live in The House With No Doors. In fact, they made it. They’re a group of mages who broke away from other houses and started their own. Lacking the imprimatur of the Emperor of Shiel put them in a bad light for awhile, but the cool stuff they construct is changing that. How about a house where the rooms come when called? How about a construct that cleans clothes? Yes, once they made nasty things, but no need to bring up the past. Now House Vour works for the betterment of mankind. You hear about those Guard Mice? Sleep the night away? Don’t even stand guard. You say there are war golems in the vault below? Don’t give them another thought. No Doors means no one can get at them anyway. Right? Oops, you say, wrong? You’re sooo correct! Put some mice in your pocket. Save #76!

165265.description:
From publisher blurb:

The town of Hermit’s Rock is waking up. Once again folks are opening businesses there and settling old caves. Nilgen Kastmire is ignorant of the history of the place. But his kids needed a fresh start, so he opened a tavern there. Too bad. It’s sad, but without your help, he’s likely going to die there. He should listen to his patron, old Andrew, always at the bar, telling whoever is buying how Sorrows Keep got its name. Or he could listen to his restless wife. Maybe she’s going to discover the were-creatures repopulating the depths of the dead city. Maybe she’ll take a shine to Oiveren, ship captain and were-crow. Maybe she’ll convert. If you’re shrewd about the trajectory of history and can read the bones of time, please, wise-up Nilgen. Interpret the dangers encroaching around him. Keep Nilgen alive!

165266.description:
From publisher blurb:

In #78, they’re all in cahoots. The Demon King, the Blood Mages, the Godslayer. Best to hook up with powers outside yourself and get that extra edge. Markontis has a demon sidekick he’s had since he was a kid. Authric studies holy books and Steelhamer trusts revelation. The Godslayer meddles in all of it and the savants in the Woodsman’s Cabin braid it all together to predict the future. It’s all too big a picture to ever comprehend all of it, but there are smaller gigs you can pick up to shove the arrows of time in one precise way or another. Try to find an Angel Tongue, a blade that keeps the dark at bay, and get in there with the guys holding the black stuff back. Or play a bad guy? See what grows out. You’re in the mix already. Make your mark. Make history.

Kingdoms rise and fall in predictable ways if you know what you’re looking for. Amoustad Dubba, Spice Merchant is a student of patterns. He sees how the ways of the world grow out the realities later called history. Just like the past, Toys for the Sandbox is one long saga and with #79 a new feature lets you trace the patterns. A reference section gives you fingertip access to “who is that?”and “when did that happen” information and gives you the ability to fill in the holes where you missed something or forgot. In this issue you’ll find spices and poisons sitting side by side in the colored bottles on the Spice Merchant’s Shelves. So be careful. Make sure your mind doesn’t explode mistaking Dead Monkey Root for Ginseng. Or maybe just listen. Those old guys? Wow! History is moving on. Might as well get the download.

165268.description:
From publisher blurb:

The newly ordained Bishop Martin has called upon your group to deliver a message across the sea. While somewhat beneath your status, the new bishop was a former adventurer of some renown. Along the way to the southern reaches the party will find themselves dropped off at the wrong port and unable to speak to the locals…and that’s just the beginning! The party will need to find the pasha, get valuable information from him to assist the new bishop, and finally get back home. This adventure goes with FT – Antioch – Kingdom of Nirack.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a group of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

165269.name: Space & Sea Battle
165269.description:
An electronic version of the classic Battleship game.
The main difference between this game and regular Electronic Battleship / Electronic Sea Battle, is the inclusion of space crafts alongside the regular navel vessels. These space crafts have a very different shape when compared to the naval vessels and thus have their own unique limitations of placement on the board.

Other features:

electronic setup and targeting
player-versus-CPU mode
Salvo fire mode (fire 5 shots at once)
Live-action mode (be the first to respond to a signal to earn the right to fire a shot)

165270.description:
From publisher blurb:

If it’s so easy, is it even important? That’s what Devlin asks himself. But what does he know? He’s just a gifted mage, coddled by his god. Does he have a true faith that will survive the battle that everyone says is coming? The Demon King is frothing to be free and Shiel Reborn is mustered right behind him. It all depends on you to ring the changes that bring this saga to the next step. So saddle up. Devlin’s got the power, but needs some guidance. Revolutionary Srin is back from #53, but don’t forget, she’s the same gene pool as the God King. Trust her if you dare. She’s the friend of Apstillias, the Sword of Knowledge, so you decide. Good Luck. The fate of the world is in this uneasy cloud and your world will soon be getting wet.

The Six Great Dragons will lead you. Don’t worry about the details. They brought civilization to all the races at the beginning of the first age and now they’re ready to emerge. They’ve designated you – you’re going to be the champion and wear the dragon scale armor the Six Great Dragons created. First assignment? Bring Micha out into the world. He may not be ready, but time is running out. He’ll be a big help to you. Imagine? He can make whatever you need out of the power of his language. See that Sickle Man there? Micha made him. So hook up to the power sources here in #81 and change the world. It’s going to change with you or without you, so step right up. Start with Micha.

165272.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Woodhamer Cooperage is about the best there is, but it’s what’s in the power plant that will really get you going. That’s where mad inventor Krvis Kyles works. Where did he come from? What’s he up to? That’s probably all to be determined somewhere further down the line. For now? Just be sure that he’s your man. People say, “Too much pipe, too many years.” Wrong. Krvis is just too smart. Now the winds of war are tuning up. The Earl of Sorlis and Adrous the Cooper are doing their part. But the one who’s going to make the real difference is Kyles. He’s a weapons man with good ideas always ready to pop. See that steam-powered metal man? If there’s going to be a fight, strap on a Steam Dragon and get behind that thing. You’ll get to tell the story for sure.

165273.description:
From publisher blurb:

Careful this will be slippery. The war for the future is moving to the Ice Falls. Those guys from the Woodsman’s Cabin wrote it this way. The Godslayer’s bought in too. So, if you want to be part of the future, you can’t escape. Pack some dragon’s blood, then use the blue salve. It will keep you warm. It will give you powers. Dumondra’s been looking for the blue men for more than a year. Now she’s looking for you. There’s no way out. Be warned though - were-creatures and a rage elemental/woman type thing are on the horizon. But get on with it. See that manga kind of girl with the flying hair approaching over the ice? That’s her. That’s Dumondra. She’s depending on you.

165275.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hermit’s Rock needs help. There’s a struggle going on– it’s the were-types who live for bleeding and screaming pitted against those who want equal rights for the weres. The more strictly human types are mixing it up, too. They want to keep the were-folks out of the southlands entirely. But before you sign to one contingent or the other? Couple of things to keep in mind. This Rock is a were-recruitment center, so there are lots of different types, old and young, coming and going. See Mistra there, that curly, soft, rich, girl-brat? She’s a recruit. (Doesn’t know what she’s getting into.) Then there are the hard to grok, sentient shadow types released into #77. They’re messing with all sides equally. Likely you won’t want to join them. But talk to Finaius. Talk to Darbin. Just don’t turn your back. Don’t walk away. Sign up. Sign now.

165276.description:
From publisher blurb:

Underwater demon-cats make for serious trouble in #85. Take note of Rakshasa Murgrow there and be forewarned. Replete with gills and fins and webbing, he’s dangerous. See the coral beads threaded in his bushy mane? He’s proud too, and beautiful. His city-craft crashed Toys world unnoticed centuries ago. Now time and population have stacked up and the powerful cats are emerging into Toys reality. So, everybody, it’s time to kick the gears of history once again. Get the demon-cats out of here! Put some sailor’s tokens in your pockets so you’ll always have enough to eat and drink. Then dive down in. There’s a rift generator there and see that spire? It’s really a guidance fin. Fix them both, then blast the cats back outside of time and space. Further if you can. That should fix ‘em. Space between worlds is the only place for them.

165277.description:
From publisher blurb:

You just may be the person Gretchen is looking for - the one to don the magical armor and bury her mother in her native crypt. The trip will cost you, of course, and staying at Hanging House might be beyond your means, but don’t forget the netting below. It’s cold there, but hanging there you’ll be able to hear the priests and their prayers will shield you from the encroaching undead. Spider John likely might talk the night through - an irritation - but also a distraction. Gretchen is praying for worthy adventurers. Is it you she’s praying for? You know you are worthy. Don’t shirk this quest. Dark Ridge Pass is a fount of necrotic activity, but you didn’t get into this to coast, did you? Step up. Tell Gretchen who you are. Shoulder the corpse. Find the necropolis.

165278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stones float at Stone Shepherds Lake. The water glows. It’s odd. But nothing exists in a vacuum, so it shouldn’t be a big surprise that the lake water might be keeping the Sky Island s afloat. That’s Tonstin’s theory, and he’s an expert on the ancient battle that changed the geography of the Moonshield forever. Now a new altercation is headed for center stage. It’s all about Princess Mishana who fled when her dad got booted. She hunkered down at the lake for years - drank the water, too. Now she’s an iron maiden, floral in appearance, but tough enough to perforate a man with a single punch, armor and all. She wants her Dad’s throne back and it looks like she’ll get it - but only with help. Your role? Stay on her good side, for sure. Sign up. Sip the water. Tough up. Win.

165279.name: The Rift Market
165279.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’re an adventurer so you’ll want to explore the Rift Market. But, please, this is a nexus to the planes. Don’t enter without a guide! True, you’re brave and fearless, but with so many non-mortal s salivating to take advantage of you, you’re going to need some help. Most importantly - don’t get caught up with the Army of Light. You might think churches are always safe and, at first, undoing the work of the Godslayer sounds like a glorious mission – but, remember, the Godslayer made his mark long ago and history ever since is a result of his finagling. Change it? You might disappear your parents. Hire Embrious. He’s eighty, but shrewd. He’ll give you the back story on everything. And ask him about Grickle. You’re the good guys, right? That little half-demon needs mentoring. Maybe you can’t fix this world, but you might save the boy.

Each week we present a new location with a map and some flavor text. In addition we add 4 NPCs with a bit of history and a few simple thoughts on how to stat them for whatever game you are playing. There are also 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them. Added to that there is usually a table or two filled with rumors and encounters.

165280.name: Sorrows Keep
165280.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Great Dragons are rousing. The battle against the corruption the Godslayer opened in the world is starting up again. But one thing first – banish the shadows of Sorrows Keep! It’s taken several lifetimes, but Shirtena, a powerful mage, knows how to do it. She’s perfected a gem that gives off a light that will cut the living shadows to ribbons. But she needs help installing it and that puts the ball squarely in your court. Probably enlist Alisha from the Falcon Guard? She’s got that Poet’s Tongue long blade that lives to banish corruption. With her you’ll probably get Gwogwore too, a fighter if you ever saw one. And don’t worry about his shape shifting proclivities. He’s got a righteous sense of ethics and won’t be a dangerment to you. Iffy? Yes. But you’ll make your legacy. The Dragon of Dawn is waiting for rescue!

Toys for the Sandbox is not a module, it is not a campaign setting, instead it is a framework for GMs to use to reinforce their own imaginations. Sometimes players zig when you expect them to zag, other times they take your plot point into a back alley and leave it penniless and bleeding. Each week we present a new location with a map and some flavor text. In addition we add 4 NPCs with a bit of history and a few simple thoughts on how to stat them for whatever game you are playing. There are also 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them. Added to that there is usually a table or two filled with rumors and encounters.

165281.name: Mind Pursuit
165281.description:
From the box

The Ultimate Test of Information & Knowledge

Are you looking for a game for the whole family? Something fun for the kids, yet challenging for the adults? Six exciting categories, three game options, and three difficulty levels make Mind Pursuit the game for you.

The categories are Science & Nature, History & Geography, TV & Film, Sports & Games, Culture, and Grab Bag. Each of these categories allows you a choice of true/false, multiple choice, or fill-in-the-blank answers. You can even set a 30 to 60 second question timer!

Structure Mind Pursuit for a point limit from 500 to 2,000; set a time limit from 30 minutes to 2 hours (highest score when time is up wins); or select the game board with animated characters for a completely different kind of strategy. At the end of every game the computer provides players or teams with ranking, score, and percentage of correct answers. In case of a tied score, the player or team with the highest percentage wins.

Some Mind Pursuit questions accept more than one correct answer. And one-letter spelling errors are usually permissible. Thousands of questions test your knowledge during the course of a game. Music and graphics clues vary the gameplay and provide additional challenge.

Features:
Up to four players or teams can participate.
Three difficulty levels for each question.
High-resolution graphics and musical clues.
Additional Questions Disks available.

165282.name: Clan of the Turtle
165282.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Playable Race of Turtles (Mutant, Ninja, and Otherwise)

Play a slow and steady tortoise, a fast-swimming terapin, or a surprisingly-nimble turtle mutant who sneaks about in shadows. Animal Races: Clan of the Turtle provides custmizable racial traits and feats for a new race of anthropomorphic turtles, including rules for enchanting one's shell as magic armor and gaining early access to thematically appropriate prestige class levels.

Also included: an overview of Turtle Clan culture, the forces that have driven Turtle Clan mutants into hiding, and the many adversaries that heroes of the Turtle Clans may face. Suit up in your heraldic colors, stare down the minions of the mysterious Dark Warrior, and rise up against injustice in ways only a Turtle can!

165283.description:
From the back of the box:
Attack & defend to sink the enemy fleet!

Find and sink your opponent's ships before they sink yours. Use shields to protect your fleet and special Power cards to improve your strategy.


This is the "lite" version of the game Battleship: Hidden Threat distributed by Wm Morrison Supermarkets PLC consisting of 50 cards for 2 players including the promotional and instruction cards.

Cards are played in a 3 x 3 grid rather than a 3 x 4 grid, and players have 3 destruction cards rather than 5.

Overview:

Each player shuffles and places their Coordinate cards face down in a grid. They then draw cards from their Destruction Card deck. Players take turns playing one card. The first player to eliminate all of their opponent's ships wins!
165283.name: Battleship

165284.name: Bop It!  Bounce
165284.description:
Bop it! meets the rubber ball/paddle game but with electronic voice commands.

Looks like a funnel with a trampoline over the big opening. You try to bounce a ball in the air off that trampoline to score points.



From the box:Obey the commands! Hit it quick hit it high! Can you keep up? Compete against your friends in a bounce-off & see if YOU can hit the all-time high score!

6 slammin' skill games!

Max Bounce

You only have 30 seconds to bounce your fastest!

Infinite Bounce

Keep it bouncing 'til you can bounce no more!

Hang Time

Catch as much air as you can in 5 bounces!

Right Height

The game calls the shots - hit it high or hit it low!

Little-Middle-Big

Hit it high... hit it low! Then hit it in the middle!

Free Form

Bounce it free style - that's any way you like!

165285.name: The Sims Freeplay
165285.description:
From the publisher website

Live free! Play free! Create up to 31 customized Sims from head to toe. Let your Sims get married, make babies, and then watch them grow into toddlers and pre-teens. Care for pets, grow gardens, even bake cakes. Give your Sims careers and earn Simoleons to improve their situations. Complete goals for Lifestyle Points, then spend them on hip items. Live with your Sims in real-time! Make your town bustle with pet stores and more. Best of all, play for free! The opportunities are limitless.

165288.name: Don Bradman Cricket 14
165288.description:
The game features a number of different game modes, including a career mode, custom matches and online games. The career mode involves a user creating a player and playing matches in order for their player to progress. A users player starts at the age of 16 and has a maximum of a 20 year career. There is also a Cricket Academy program in which a user can create and edit teams, players and competitions. This was released as a stand alone game before the console release date. Big Ant Studios updated the academy and brought the 'Practice Nets' feature into it in the weeks prior to the launch of the full game.

The gameplay features were announced as having "Unique Batting and Bowling Controls" with a full 360 shot delivery with no shot markers. The gameplay also involves a "Fully featured Fielding System" which allows "full control of the field". The Ball Physics in the game has been labelled as having "realistic edges and ball movement off players". Appeal and Electric Reviews have also been included into the game, which enables a user to challenge the umpire for a decision in which is questionable. There are Practice nets and Match practice which are new features to the game and are supposed to help a new 'cricketing gamer' to play the game. Users can also save games online and offline. The commentary team consists of Matthew Hill and David Basheer.

The game includes 79 teams within the game, most of which are unlicensed. There are international and domestic teams (current generation) historical teams and future generation teams. There are 17 international teams, 6 Australian domestic teams, 18 English domestic, along with "All time best" teams and "historical" teams.

There are 11 unlicensed grounds within the game, with 2 licensed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Don Bradman Cricket 14", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165289.name: Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark
165289.description:
Transformers: Rise of Dark Spark is an action-adventure video game based on the Transformers toy franchise. It was developed primarily by Edge of Reality, with the Nintendo 3DS version developed by WayForward Technologies. It was published by Activision and released worldwide on June 24, 2014. It is the third installment in the War for Cybertron series and the fourth installment in the movie game series. The game was released on June 24, 2014 for Microsoft Windows, Nintendo 3DS, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Wii U, Xbox 360, and Xbox One. The game serves as both a prequel to Transformers: Fall of Cybertron and the film Transformers: Age of Extinction.

The console and Microsoft Windows versions of Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark are a third-person shooter, much like its predecessors from High Moon Studios Transformers: War for Cybertron, Transformers: Fall of Cybertron, and Transformers: Dark of the Moon. The game has a single-player campaign. Escalation, the online multiplayer mode where four players fend off waves of increasingly tough enemies, returned with the addition of upgradable defenses. The mode features over forty playable characters, and has levels based on both Cybertron and Earth. Escalation mode is absent in the Wii U and 3DS versions of the game. In addition, experience points collected by players in both single and multiplayer will be shared.

The 3DS version of the game is a strategy RPG.[6] Melee combat is turn-based. The player is given three rounds to deplete their opponent's health. If successful, the enemy is removed from the overworld map. The player can choose from seven different attacks, each with their own recharge time after each use. Combat will use 3D rendered character models, while the overworld screen uses 2D sprites, similar to the 3DS game Fire Emblem Awakening.

Source: Wikipedia, "Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165290.name: Grid Autosport
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
165290.description:
Grid Autosport (styled as GRID Autosport) is a racing video game by Codemasters and is the sequel to 2008's Race Driver: Grid and 2013's Grid 2. The game was released for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 on June 24, 2014. The game features the return of in-car view that was removed from Grid 2 and changed handling with 100 routes across 22 locations.

Source: Wikipedia, "Grid Autosport", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

165291.name: BlazBlue: Chrono Phantasma
165291.description: BlazBlue: Chrono Phantasma, released in Japan as BlazBlue: Chronophantasma (ブレイブルー クロノファンタズマ BureiBurū Kuronofantazuma?), is a 2-D fighting game developed by Arc System Works. It is the third game of the Blazblue series, set after the events of BlazBlue: Continuum Shift. The game was originally to be released first as an arcade game in the fourth quarter of 2012, which was later pushed forward to November 2012. A PlayStation 3 version of the game was released in Japan on October 24, 2013, while it was released in the United States on March 25, 2014. Due to limited hardware and disc space on the Xbox 360, Chrono Phantasma is currently only available for PlayStation systems.

165292.name: The Dark Sands
165292.description: The Dark Sands takes the game system from Ted S. Raicer’s sold-out and critically acclaimed The Dark Valley: The East Front Campaign to the legendary battles of North Africa in WWII. From the most successful British armored operation of the war, Operation Compass, to the climactic battle two years later at El Alamein, The Dark Sands breaks new ground in portraying the campaigns of the British 8th Army and Rommel’s Afrika Korps.

165293.name: Apollo: A Voyage to the Moon
165293.description: An educational trivia game published in the same year as the first manned landing on the Moon. A race to be the first to visit the Moon and return, players answer trivia questions about general science and the Apollo mission to move their golf tee pawns around the Moon and back to Earth. Progressive rules are provided to allow for play by novice astronauts.

165294.name: Would You Rather...? twisted, sick and wrong
boardgameimplementation: Zobmondo!! Would you rather...? Twisted, sick and wrong. Late night.
165294.description:
This is an adult version of the party game Would You Rather...?. The game features entirely new cards and questions, with a good number of the questions being sexual. Many other questions involve bodily functions and are just meant to be gross, and a few are adult in that they challenge religious ideas or moral gray areas. Some of the questions are tame, and could easily have been adapted into the normal game. The age of the game has been raised from 12 & up to 16 & up. Otherwise the game plays like the normal version of Would You Rather...?.

From the Box:

In this sick, twisted, and wrong version you'll find questions that are nauseating, bizarre, and disturbing, but each is a field tested conversation starter that is guaranteed to provide ridiculous fun, break the ice at any party and--if played correctly--open a unique window into the twisted imaginations of friends and family!

165295.name: Aliens Vs. Predator (1994/Arcade)
165295.description:
From Wikipedia,

Alien vs. Predator is a beat 'em up video game developed and released by Capcom for the CPS-2 arcade game system in 1994. In the game, the players take control of up to three human and Predator characters in a battle against the Alien hordes and rogue human soldiers. The game was very well received by fans and media publications, becoming a classic title for many fans of the beat 'em up genre, but was never ported to any home system.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alien_vs._Predator_(arcade_game)

165296.name: Totally Spies! Totally Swamp Romp!
165296.description:
User input,

A compilation of Totally Spies! Swamp Monster Blues and Totally Spies! Zombie Jamboree.

SWAMP MONSTER BLUES - Travel deep into the dangerous Louisiana Bayou to save him from the Swamp Monster -- all while avoiding getting mud on your too cool outfits. With the Totally Spies Swamp Monster adventure, you'll have fun learning essential skills like problem-solving, planning and decision-making, trial and error, reading, math and so much more.

ZOMBIE JAMBOREE - The coolest girls to ever use a gadget, Totally Spies, are on a desperate chase through a zombie-filled shopping mall complete with mesmerized people and bad taste! The Totally Spies Zombie Jamboree adventure features four exciting activities, glorious color graphics and three levels of interactive play. Have fun learning essential skills like problem-solving, planning and decision-making, trial and error, reading, math and more. Extend the adventure with the 32-page puzzle code book.

165297.description: An expansion for the Heroes of Normandie base game. This expansion consists of a single punchboard, including the East Yorkshire Regiment.
165297.name: Heroes of Normandie: British Platoon

165298.description: An expansion for the Heroes of Normandie base game. This expansion consists of a single punchboard, including the Royal Winnipeg Rifles.
165298.name: Heroes of Normandie: Canadian Platoon

165299.name: Demon: the Descent Storyteller's Screen
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
165299.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A sturdy three-panel screen featuring the beautiful collage of Demon: the Descent art on the outer side, and on the inside there's a selection of charts and other info to make the Storyteller's job a little bit easier.

165300.name: Samsara
165300.description:
from the website

Samsara is a tabletop role-playing game about street-level heroes who use crazy spiritual powers to fight criminals, ghosts, and monsters.

165301.name: Tradecraft
165301.description:
from the website

Cold war era spy crap is cool! Dead drops and car tosses, false flags and double agents, cut-outs and provocateurs. This game is one, big excuse to make spy shit happen.

In Tradecraft, a group of spymasters (Handlers) compete to see who can pull off the best covert pass of information between two spies (Assets) under enemy surveillance and in full view of the public.

165302.description:
From the four corners of the land come four pretenders to the throne, each claiming to be the rightful heir. As the four would-be Kings march towards the capitol, they gather their armies, preparing for battle.

One comes for Glory. One comes for Greed. One comes for Blood. One comes for Honour.

King Down is an epic strategy game for 2-4 players, where each player allies themselves with one King, hand picks their army and goes into battle by competing to take down the other Kings and cross the board to victory.

Described as ‘the prequel to Chess’, King Down incorporates age-old, intricate and fascinating mechanics from ‘the Game of Kings’ but breaks all the rules by re-imagining the classic pieces, introducing brand new characters, and including new spell cards, strategies, tactics and win conditions. King Down is a brand new game that will stand the test of time and last the ages.

Game components:
Rule book
Double-sided game board
40 miniatures (10 per player)
80 game cards
boardgameversion: First Sword in the Stone edition
165302.name: King Down
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 11: Roll for the Galaxy, Big Trouble in Little China, and Monument Valley
The Game Pit: Episode 30 - Picking Over the Bones

165303.name: Aces Wild: Manic Brawling Action!
165303.description:
Source: The Game Website.

- Manic aerial hand to hand Combat!
- Offencive and defensive martial arts skills!
- Wild system scales difficulty with risk and style!
- 3 playable characgter, local co-op! Fully voiced!

165305.name: Hoyrall
165305.description:
From publisher blurb:

Insectoid humanoids have infested the Underworld and now these odd aliens are ready to invade your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game as well! Read about the strange god Zagnexis, how these bug men fit into the history of Aventyr, and so much more about the four-armed hoyrall!

In Underworld Races: Hoyrall you’ll find…

a brand new player race for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game!
three different poisonous subtypes!
favored class options for every role!
new (living) equipment like the communicative mating vencegran and spitting siktauryi!
the siktauryi specialist gunslinger archetype!
new feats like Fast Hands, Toxic Blood, Carnivorous Appetite and more!
new magic items like the phantom limb and alien antennae!
fascinating countenance, prismatic eyes, and more new spells!

165306.name: Millennium Knights Player's Guide
165306.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's 1999 and monsters don't exist. They’re the stuff of legend and myth, right? Wrong. Our world is filled with paranormal creatures just itching to enslave humanity or wipe it off the face of the Earth.

Only the world’s finest agents stand between the paranormal horror and an unsuspecting public. Outfitted with the best technology and tradecraft, it's time to get to work.

Wear the tuxedo, load the Walther PPK, and save the world!

Product Contains: A 44-page high resolution pdf that is mutli-layered so that you can create your own print friendly version. Millennium Knights is part of the Suzerain Continuum.

165307.name: Among the Brave
165307.description:
From publisher blurb:

Among the Brave is a story roleplaying game set in Deadlands: The Weird West. But something isn’t right here. Something doesn’t add up. This time, the residents of a small tribe near the Coyote Confederation have just vanished. After weeks of nonstop chanting, the village has gone silent and all that remains are the tents and tipis. Locals from the town of Brisco refuse to go near the place.

Among the Brave plays differently from any of the previous Tall Tales. For starters, the players only have some of the information available at the onset. Secondly, there are a number of vignette breaks to answer questions about what is going on. Thirdly, there are new rules for resolving conflict, a Spirit World vignette, and a new ending chart with a lot more doom.

Get ready for the strangest, darkest Tall Tale ever.

The heroes who must survive the wild are lightning-fast gunfighters, card-slinging hucksters, mad scientists, or even common townsfolk.

But they’d best be quick—their fate is in their hands.

165308.name: Yukon Terror
165308.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yukon Terror is a story roleplaying game set in Deadlands: The Weird West. A group of strangers have taken shelter in an Alaskan cabin on the edge of civilization. Outside, cold winds slam against the shelter while those inside must figure out who can be trusted…

The northern frontier is home to more than just cold and ice. Unique beasts and abominations have made their home in the frozen north, some hiding for centuries, aided by the natural camouflage of the tundra and wilderness. Some in fact, may have taken the form of travelers and strangers coming in from the cold…

How long can the storm continue? Can anything survive it? Can the group endure the storm and each other? When the storm finally breaks and the sun shines on the cabin, who will be left alive? Who among them is not what they seem?

The heroes who must survive the wild are lightning-fast gunfighters, card-slinging hucksters, mad scientists, or even common townsfolk. But they’d best be quick—their fate is in their hands.

165309.name: Trail of Darkness
165309.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trail of Darkness is a story roleplaying game set in Deadlands: The Weird West. A group of men and women have recently lost their friend Caleb at the hands of a black magician and cult leader. Defying the odds and any sense of self-preservation, the group has sworn to avenge their fallen friend. Only problem is, they don’t know who the magician is or where he’s gone.

Travelling over hundreds of miles of open terrain, hunting down every clue imaginable, the group has finally secured one solid piece of information about the killer. He is now living in the small settlement of Bell Creek, on the edge of the silver mines in Northern Nevada. Apparently, he’s disguised himself as a holy man there and is living among normal folk, along with key members of his cult.

But how long will he stay there before moving on to his next con? Can the heroes track him down and exact justice? Or will it be cold hard vengeance?

165310.name: Ghost Train
165310.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghost Train is a story roleplaying game set in Deadlands: The Weird West. A group of outlaws have recently heard of a train coming through Bottleneck Falls loaded with ghost rock — not to mention a high-stakes floating poker game. Armed to the teeth with guards, the train has never been successfully robbed. But that won’t stop these desperados from launching their plan.

Ghost Train plays differently from any of the previous Tall Tales. For starters, the players only have some of the information available at the onset. Secondly, there are three different ways to play this one, which means there are a lot more set-up options. Thirdly, there are new rules for resolving conflict, a Cliffhanger, and a new ending chart for each story type. Finally, the PCs can be the bad guys in this one if they want to.

Get ready for the fastest, wildest Tall Tale ever.

The heroes who must survive the wild are lightning-fast gunfighters, card-slinging hucksters, mad scientists, or even common townsfolk. But they’d best be quick—their fate is in their hands.

165311.name: Dr. Tregan's Collateral Trouble
165311.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doctor Tregan’s Collateral Trouble is a story roleplaying game set in Deadlands: The Weird West. In this Tall Tale, Doctor Tregan has been abducted in the dead of night by bandits. His shop has been left unattended. And it’s only a matter of time before his trail runs cold.

The town of Buford Junction relies on the good doctor’s work to keep things like generators, tractors, and weapons humming. Left unattended, the shop could fall into the wrong hands and some of his inventions could wreak havoc on the citizens of Buford Junction. Only a few stalwart men and women have what it takes to rescue Doctor Tregan and see that justice is done.

Who has taken him? Is it old creditors come to collect? Or nefarious outlaws with unkind plans? Will the doctor be killed once he builds them a fantastic machine? Or is he a hostage held for some enormous ransom? Perhaps he’s just a pawn in some sick game.

The heroes who must survive the wild are lightning-fast gunfighters, card-slinging hucksters, mad scientists, or even common townsfolk. But they’d best be quick—the doctor’s fate is in their hands.

165312.name: Mythic Curses Volume II
165312.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dreaded Curses Return!

In folklore and fantasy media, curses are powerful supernatural forces that are not to be trifled with, which can take on lives of their own, and respond to the actions of the poor wretches unfortunate enough to have been accursed. These curses are mysterious and terrifying, punishing transgressors for their misdeeds and reacting to the events that happen to their victims, sometimes even becoming adversaries in and of themselves. In Pathfinder and the 3.5 OGL however, curses are just a minor nuisance that is quickly resolved with remove curse or break enchantment.

This book includes all of the rules for mythic curses, originally found in Mythic Mastery: Mythic Curses, but also includes five new mythic curses. Mythic curses use the mythic rules presented in Mythic Adventures as a starting point to create dynamic curses, which respond (positively or negatively) to the actions of their victims, and which generally require a whole lot more than a simple spell to get rid of. Included in this book are such dreaded mythic curses as the curse of cowardice, which fills its victims with overwhelming fear at the worst possible times, the curse of shrinking, which causes the victim to shrink to incredibly tiny sizes, and may even shrink them permanently, the curse of transfiguration, which transforms victims into various beasts and objects, and tampers with his memory and sense of identity, and even more dangerous curses beyond those!

165313.name: The Magic of Chaos (5E)
165313.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Magic Of Chaos introduces a new way of adding spell-casting monsters to your campaign.

The threat of Orcus, and Chaos in general, is a looming presence in the land of Cairnvarthi. Make your players feel its glorious, evil power with monsters that attack with a bang!

Included in this small tome are twenty new spells for shaman monsters, almost all of them scalable to be used by anything from the lowliest goblin shaman, up to Orcus himself!

165314.name: The Falcon Academy
165314.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue was orignaly released as an exclusive for those who downloaded issue 0 during the first 24 hours it was availible. Now it goes on sale for the first time. The Falcon Acadmey is a place where master swordsmen are forged.

165315.name: Apothecaries, Hermits and The Astral Star
165315.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is where the saga begins. Toys will grow out many unusual things, but this is where it starts. This is where the fighting librarians from Ethos set out. This is where the Orc Queen takes the first step on her march to the Peace Bringer. Right here in Toys Volume I, this is the roots of all of it, of all the published issues and of those still expanding in the pod. In a saga writ large and ongoing a philosophy of the dice begins to develop and it all starts to make sense. And it’s never written in stone. It’s for you to play God with. Pick up some Toys. Scatter the pieces. Take each chapter and mold it with the secret stuff that’s only known to you. That’s the way this world works. Live it.

Toys. The Omni. Issues 1-18. A good deal of fun.

Toys for the Sandbox is not a module, it is not a campaign setting, instead it is a framework for GMs to use to reinforce their own imaginations. Sometimes players zig when you expect them to zag, other times they take your plot point into a back alley and leave it penniless and bleeding. Each week we present a new location with a map and some flavor text. In addition we add 4 NPCs with a bit of history and a few simple thoughts on how to stat them for whatever game you are playing. There are also 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them. Added to that there is usually a table or two filled with rumors and encounters.

165316.name: Toys for the Sandbox Special #1
165316.description:
From publisher blurb:

Toys has taken some amazing turns in the last hundred-plus issues and, at bargain prices, hot summer days beg for a revisit to some of its roots. In this four issue Toys treasury, the Apothecary introduces what becomes an ongoing theme of herbs and poisons and spells. Supernatural creatures arrive in the first issues as well and holy men and prophecy announce themselves. Also included in these first four plots is the initial pub story, The Gryphon Gambling, launching a good fun theme that repeats every several months. Next week’s issue (#130) is a pub issue, featuring Halfling spies plotting to put the Elves and their inflated ideas of their own superiority in their place. Want to investigate levitating mining camps? Outmaneuver plotting mushrooms? Make the acquaintance of kamikaze rabbits, ears tied back for combat? Be charmed by a master storyteller? This is Toys. This is where Toys started.

Toys for the Sandbox is not a module, it is not a campaign setting, instead it is a framework for GMs to use to reinforce their own imaginations. Sometimes players zig when you expect them to zag, other times they take your plot point into a back alley and leave it penniless and bleeding. Each week we present a new location with a map and some flavor text. In addition we add 4 NPCs with a bit of history and a few simple thoughts on how to stat them for whatever game you are playing. There are also 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them. Added to that there is usually a table or two filled with rumors and encounters.

165318.name: Rivet Wars: The Red Baron
165318.description:
From the back of the box:

Terror of the skies, the RED BARON has more air victories than any other ace on either the Blight or Allied sides! He is both a skilled and aggressive pilot making him a match for any opponent. Most pilots will flee at the sight of his triplane!

165319.name: Rivet Wars: Reme Funck
165319.description:
From the back of the box:

REME FUNCK was a bomb thrower in a late model plane until his pilot was killed, requiring Reme to take the controls and land the plane. Reme was promoted to pilot and soon was flying his own biplane. He quickly demonstrated his aerial prowess by downing five blight fighters in a day. As one of the Allies' top aces, Reme is always a welcome of any air group.

165320.description:
From the game box: "Answer the call of the diamond - A new game, to be played on the familiar board of Afrikan Tähti, which will take your adventure to a whole new level!"

Afrikan tähti - Retkikunnat is an expansion to Afrikan tähti, the most popular Finnish board game. Actually, it's more like a new game, played using the components of the old game. Instead of hunting directly for the treasure, players must first form a team, finding resources and allies. Once the team is ready, players can start hunting for the big diamond.

Finding the big diamond is not the end of it, like in the original game: now it's possible to steal the treasure from another player.

Also, players do not start with identical resources: each player has a different character, with special powers.
165320.name: Afrikan tähti: Retkikunnat

165322.name: The Traveling Show
165322.description:
From publisher blurb:

Broldsen met Stanly when they performed years ago at the Dreck and Bother. What a disaster! But later they met to commiserate and hit it off. Now they’re running a super successful theatre troupe and having fun. Broldsen and Stanly need you.

165323.description:

But first she needs someone to gather the girl’s scattered bones (the suitor’s too) then bring a cleric and she will stage a wedding. It’s worth a try. Pack some Demon Dog Bones - a good first line attack - and some Red Willow Bark Potion. And the wedding present. Don’t forget that.

From publisher blurb:

The Empty Chamber is a ghost story. A monk whose extensive learning drove him mad died or in some other way slipped out of reality there. It was a smart move with the world in a mess and the end of the age coming. The Old Seer was conniving , weaving events into cats’ cradles full of knots and glue. But supernatural fingers don’t get stuck and, from where he’s at, the Mad Monk can slip new tangles into the Old Seer’s twists and skew the game toward a new age of peace and harmony. It doesn’t always look benign. Case in point - those Secret Sisters of the Perfect World, the Mad Monk’s posse of assassin nuns. But trust that a brain tinctured in the supernatural knows more than you do and take a lesson. Look through the lens of #92 for a glimpse of the whole picture.

She’s a ghost, but she still looks for her lost love. If the Dark Lady sees you, she’ll make you help, maybe even send you to search the other side for her. So be warned, if you see the Dark Lady, it’s curtains for you. She’s even got her own cemetery. But, you’re brave, you say? You can handle this? Then help Jainis, an out-of-his-depth ghost buster and free the Dark Lady from her own murderous grief. There’s a Bu’Idu Ikul you can probably use. Vivian’s seen the Dark Lady and her clock is ticking. Maybe you can even save her with that ghost-eating blade. And, watch your own back - October is bringing out storms of ghosts. Mutations and twisted offspring plagued the Westmores and they collared and chained them in the cellar. But the monsters discovered their lineage and rebelled. So, don’t make it an enemy. Don’t make it want you for a friend either. But do try to wake the Apothecary whose brain the Child messed with. He knows how to cure disease. If he won’t waken? Rap sharply on his specimen jar. If you ask the right question, maybe he can chain the Child.

From publisher blurb:

Halloween is one thing, but this story goes a whole lot further than a spook ever traveled. A kid stomps water on a witch and she gets so mad she kills all the male type people in town? And she doesn’t stop there. She displaces part of the soul of every living villager as well and scatters the fragments throughout the universe. Now the villagers need to eat the flesh of others to find their stolen soul bits. All this nastiness propelled the village outside of time – messed with the weather of reality and made them a wild card even the Godslayer can’t manipulate. It put the God Who Never Was back into play too, so maybe what the witch started will someday save the world. Want to volunteer? Pick up a soul trinket to make the cannibals want you. Avoid getting roasted, then help bamboozle the Godslayer.

From publisher blurb:

Once the Peluda helped the gods spread life throughout the world. But all that changed and the Peluda became a monster producer instead. Now, the Third Age is dawning and what the world needs now are heroes to see it through the next big dust up. The Peluda is helping, making monsters to inspire men to be heroes. You? You want to be a hero? The Peluda’s got some nifty treasure to reward those who make the cut. Tests are going on right now, so find Reginald, if you want to try your luck. He’s a wolf in appearance, so you’ll have to seek him out. The secret? Just get a conversation with a wolf going. From there on it will all be part of the test, so polish your boots and mind you’re at your spiffiest. Take it away, hero. You’re the fulcrum - the future is teetering.

From publisher blurb:

Count Rolet had been in clandestine cahoots with demons for years. Now they’ve got a landing in The Spice City and the fight to oust them is on. But the city goes after the Count before vanquishing the demons . Big mistake! Look at Brustin Vos with his lidless eyes and garments woven right into his skin. That’s the direction they want to go? Sure, Brustin is a powerful demon mage and he’s wallowing in bliss, but come on! Follow his lead? Demons will win for sure and reduce humans to pea-brains fed on sensual titillations. It’s up to you to fix this. Search out Avlina. She’s a good commander - just young, just inexperienced. She’s not like you with multiple issues of Toys under your belt. You’ve got the whole picture. From publisher blurb:

The Godslayer got imprisoned on Pirate Island when he killed the God That Never Was. Now he’s a soothsayer fishing on a pier and pulling strings to manipulate the future. He’s got times and dates and players finagled into place. The result? He’ll set himself free, he hopes. His latest ploy is the Gold Fields scam with an amiable dwarf poised to stumble on gold at Mt. Holy Wall. The old seer’s got it all ready. It’s all set. And it’s a go! There’s no avoiding this Gold Rush. But Sherile is working for the other side - the mages and the Woodsman. She’s posing as an assayer and stymieing the miners and the Godslayer as well. Her job is to keep the world steady on course. So step up. Pick a side. Help the Godslayer? From publisher blurb:

Arlon was just a kid when his family got attacked at Wreckers’ Wall. They perished and he had to fend for himself while waiting to grow up. Later Arlon worked at adventuring, but never got to be the strongest guy ever. So he set up Heroes’ Hall, an inn, a school and a memorial to adventurers where he bolstered himself - others too - with medics and an alcove full of healing potions. Today Heroes’ Hall is a nice place to visit, but, BE WARNED, keep your hands off the displays. Uh, oh! Too late now. One of your party just swiped the Helm of Iverest and now he’s fixated on a quest for dragon armor. boardgamecompilation: Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings
165332.description:
This edition of Puerto Rico contains 14 additional buildings, previously released as Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings.


In Puerto Rico players assume the roles of colonial governors on the island of Puerto Rico. The aim of the game is to amass victory points by shipping goods to Europe or by constructing buildings.

Each player uses a separate small board with spaces for city buildings, plantations, and resources. Shared between the players are three ships, a trading house, and a supply of resources and doubloons.

The resource cycle of the game is that players grow crops which they exchange for points or doubloons. Doubloons can then be used to buy buildings, which allow players to produce more crops or give them other abilities. Buildings and plantations do not work unless they are manned by colonists.

During each round, players take turns selecting a role card from those on the table (such as "Trader" or "Builder"). When a role is chosen, every player gets to take the action appropriate to that role. The player that selected the role also receives a small privilege for doing so - for example, choosing the "Builder" role allows all players to construct a building, but the player who chose the role may do so at a discount on that turn. Unused roles gain a doubloon bonus at the end of each turn, so the next player who chooses that role gets to keep any doubloon bonus associated with it. This encourages players to make use of all the roles throughout a typical course of a game.

Puerto Rico uses a variable phase order mechanic, where a "governor" token is passed clockwise to the next player at the conclusion of a turn. The player with the token begins the round by choosing a role and taking the first action.

Players earn victory points for owning buildings, for shipping goods, and for manned "large buildings." Each player's accumulated shipping chips are kept face down and come in denominations of one or five. This prevents other players from being able to determine the exact score of another player. Goods and doubloons are placed in clear view of other players and the totals of each can always be requested by a player. As the game enters its later stages, the unknown quantity of shipping tokens and its denominations require players to consider their options before choosing a role that can end the game.

The new buildings are: Aqueduct, Forest House, Black Market, Storehouse, Guesthouse, Church, Trading Post, Small Wharf, Lighthouse, Library, Speciality Factory, Union Hall, Cloister, and Statue.

165333.description: The Game of Roaches is a beginner RPG that allows players to play as roaches who are trying to take over the house for themselves. Players will battle the everyday dangers in the house, such as the bug spray or chancla, in order to get into the rooms, like the kitchen or bathroom, to battle it out for ultimate control of the house. Players will roleplay as the various characters of roaches (cowboy, luchador, spy, etc.) to practice their roleplaying imagination skills. The game offers three levels of play which allows for very young gamers to play with experienced gamers.

From publisher blurb:

Toys #100 - This issue is the key. It ties up all the connections, ties them up with a bow. Eww! That’s not a bow! That’s a succubus. Winsome, yes, approachable, beguiling - Crylas by name. But, quick, if you touched her - suck and spit! Just don’t get distracted. See, over there? Dragon like and princely, holding aloft the dragon armors of Mercy and Rage? It’s the Dragon Prince balancing out onto the blade of history. He’s just a fragment of god stuff himself, still wrapped in corruption, but ready to wake his brothers, the Six Great Dragons and take on the Demon King. Help him. Help the Dragon Prince vanquish The Corruption the Godslayer visited on the world. You’ll be able to fight past death itself when you don the armor. And one more thing? Forsake pleasure. Pleasure is a demon’s tool. Not for heroes

165335.description:
Game of horse racing up to 9 players (but there are 10 horses).
With the smart card play the player who cuts the finish line first win.
The cards have values ​​of movement from 1 to 7, there are some cards that double movement and others that allow you to stand still waiting for a better time to launch the sprint.
It is not uncommon that a horse can not move or should move in an illegal manner because of the blocks of the opponent and then be disqualified.

Maybe if you scramble around inside his head you can protect your memories and personality. Try. Mauthelest is lurking and she’s interested in you. While you’re inside, take a look around and get a lay of the land. Maybe you can rescue Makou. She’s a victim, singing so aimless at the market gate, hollow eyed and stupid. Talk to the Dream Seller. She knows all about this stuff and what happened to Makou. She says she’s got a direct link to the Dragon Prince so maybe there’s an upside to all this? True, he probably didn’t know as much about the Great Worm as Toys aficionados do, but he ended up in jail and not only that, with a hundred broken bones to boot. Dying? He craved that pleasant escape, but, too bad, it wasn’t available to the likes of him. So, please, some compassion here. Get through the mountains of Ikkibu-Kur, outwit the demons. Rescue the old guy. Maybe get the Burrower’s Compass from that survivalist in the valley and whisk Moltenheart’s misshapen bones to sanctuary somewhere. A comfy niche with the Unaligned? From publisher blurb:

So wondrously constructed, so adept at unlayering the human psyche, so admiring of the staggering physical beauty of your home world. He understands you. You’ll want to free Oish just to watch his translucence flowingly manipulate his eye-pods over and around you. So stand strong. The Society of the Rose will help you resist. And keep your eye on the Hell Gate. See it opening? That’s really what it’s all about. Christmas and babies and curly haired kids - they’re all at stake. So dose up on discipline. Big. What is that thing? A petrified corpse? A fallen down statue? Must be 60 feet or more. Don’t touch those rocks piling up where it’s crumbling away. They’re chaos rocks, for sure. They’ll fuel somebody’s dark magic, but you don’t want ‘em. If you’ve even sucked in their floating excrescence, head for the Daashiono’s garden - it’s right nearby. The plants there play the Song of Creation, so breathe deep. Expose your skin and face to it. The song healed the Daashiono of the raging in his skull and will pump your strengths as well. But, wait. It’s not about you. The seeds are the thing. The music locked in them will save the world. First? The Daashiono. Strain the song through all of them. Keep their power. Wash out the evil. Lucky you. But wait! An elven minx (up to no good) tossed in a game changer. She found the dragon key and plans to use it. The Godslayer, that malignant sage, wants it too and seers throughout the world are watching the key rippling their worlds of prophecy. What’s up and what’s down in this adventure? Support the Iron Dragon? The Seer of Pirate Island? Are the Storm Elves the good guys in this new chapter? Even the elf girl and the trolls want your help. Sky City, a mythic, elvish place that branches high above the Long Ridge Mountains, needs some muscle. To volunteer, enter through the Sky Gate and get on the Sky Road – a tower, actually. It will bring you up to the city itself. Vashana’s in charge here. She’s liberal, proud of it too, but she’s starting to realize her society’s gotten way too elastic. Count Rolet’s brother, Agustus, inveigled his way in as ambassador. Vashana doesn’t know exactly what he’s up to, though she’s sure it’s not good. Agustus knows how to make nice, but contrary to elvish goals, he’s in Sky City to develop allies for the Demon King. His plans are fool proof. His patsies are in place to keep blame off himself. Ask Ironline. Talk to Maludine. Decode their stories and tell Vashana what’s going on. The future starts here. You need to take charge.

White smoke rises when it’s time for the Trade Fair. The tribes and clans gather. Colonists from Port Morganti come too bringing some really special stuff. But no two years are the same. This year there’s a drought. Game is scarce. Dwarf zombies are creeping out of the caves near the trade grounds - maybe even eating young children. A magical rage infected barbarian hunter Mordain and he killed someone. Now he’s got to provide sons for the dead guy, so there’s got to be a wedding. Smoke rising against blue skies and autumn leaves? the clans gathering? a wedding in the offing? It’s a picturesque surfacescape, but destiny projections aren’t that good for anyone here. It’s good you’re there on the scene with the party. Hear that terrified screaming above the ambient sounds of the Songbird Stones? That’s the bride. Start there.
